It glows in the dark, And sings to me, the tune of 'Yesterday' On the second day of Christmas My true love gave to me A Mastercard and Visa With a twenty dollar limit on each. On the third day of Christmas My true love gave to me her warmth A tender hand to hold, a steamy cup Of coco, then she pointed the way home ~ On the fourth day of Christmas My true love gave to me her spirit of Caring mixed with a song to sing upon a star In praise of the season, and a vision of faith In the image of three Magi traveling afar ~ On the fifth day of Christmas My true love gave to me Five Enron shares With an option to purchase more On the sixth day of Christmas My true love gave to me Six long stem roses With the bill addressed to me On the seventh day of Christmas My true love gave to me Seven nights of the week~Blessed To hear him snoring, lying next to me On the eigth day of Christmas My true love gave to me Eight days in Baghdad At a two star hotel On the ninth day of Christmas My true love gave to me Nine AAA batteries Just in case.... On the tenth day of Christmas My true love gave to me Ten packs of Tylenol And a wish list hanging on the tree On the eleventh day of Christmas My true love gave to me Eleven silver sprockets And a subscription to swimsuit illustrated for him On the twelfth day of Christmas My true love gave to me A red velvet cake And a poem of promise, To love me for all eternity

In tune with nephthys' valentine's daily blog, here' s my contribution for singles who fret about getting attached.. :) This is very much filtered from a buddhist website ... Wednesday, January 15, 2003 A "Love Letter" to a Friend Dear Xin, All we have now is this moment to relish, to live in. Why fret being single when single? Why fret being married when married? If the situation can be changed to what your heart desires, do it. If not, enjoy this moment without lament. Live happily in each moment, moment to moment. This is your life now. Don't let it slip away. The fail-proof way to attract love is to be a loving person to everyone, even strangers. People love loving people; the unloving are more "unlovable." If someone is attracted to you in the moment because of your loving-ness, relish the moment of being loved and make the next decision from there...

A Song of Daphne to the Lute My Daphne's Hair is twisted Gold, Bright stars a-piece her Eyes do hold, My Daphne's Brow inthrones the Graces, My Daphne's Beauty stains all Faces, On Daphne's Cheeks grow Rose and Cherry, On Daphne's Lip a sweeter Berry, Daphne's snowy Hand but touch'd does melt, And then no heavenlier Warmth is felt, My Daphne's voice tunes all the Spheres, My Daphne's Music charms all Ears. Fond am I thus to sing her praise ; These glories now are turn'd to Bayes. --John Wyly Anyone who did sec 4 Lit poems would remember this I think ;)

There is a pleasure in the pathless woods There is a pleasure in the pathless woods, There is a rapture on the lonely shore, There is society, where none intrudes, By the deep sea, and music in its roar: I love not man the less, but Nature more, From these our interviews, in which I steal From all I may be, or have been before, To mingle with the Universe, and feel What I can ne'er express, yet cannot all conceal. Lord Byron I love this poem because it describes to the T what I feel in this one line: I love not man the less, but Nature more

Pulling an "All-in-one" I apologise for the all in one post. I should really check this blog more often... :) 1) Happy Chinese New Year (Its not too late is it?) 2) Concerning Families: I never realised how many cousins I have till I did a head count the other day. 42 cousins (excluding my two siblings and me). The worst (or best depending on how you look at it) is they're all in Singapore. Its no wonder I find family gatherings so.... stifling... 3) Children: Children are annoying. This is my personal opinion (I don't expect everyone-or anyone for that matter- to share it with me). Actually, no, I find babies much much worse. I find them gross. There is something in a baby that just triggers such disgust in me. This of course, I have to hide because, who doesn't like babies? You have to seriously be abnormal to hate babies right? Because they're just to loveable. I just want to puke. I don't find them cute, I don't like their overly large eyes. I don't like how they smell (puke and milk is not a good smell you guys...). And I dislike Anne Geddes with all of my heart. They don't do anything interesting, they cry and puke a lot. What I don't understand is why adults like to carry babies and the pass them around to other adults. I always go "pass" when they get to me and that's when I get the questioning looks and the raised eyebrows. The only time I can tolerate babies is when they're asleep. And even then I don't find them cute. They just look peaceful and I respect that. Anyway, back to children, most children in Singapore are ill-mannered. They are also selfish and think the world of themselves. This reflects upbringing. I must admit I have encountered well mannered and likeable children but they are few and hard to come by. So as a general rule, I find children unlikeable too. When there are nice children though, I find I take to them almost immediately. I like the whole "child's perspective" thing and how they're always curious, and get excited for some things. In other words, how they're not jaded. If I could maintain that state most of my life, I think I'll be happy.

Beyond Our Shores I rarely write about events that occur outside our little island, but the world is in a turmoil. We are plagued by tragedies and bad news. How much tragedy can the human race take? When has living become so difficult? The talk of war, the rise of terrorism, economic uncertainty, the destruction of nature and more recently, the space tragedy makes one wonder when life will ever be pleasant again. Reading the newspapers have become such a chore lately. War, water issues, death. This Earth is sick and its inhabitants are doing their best to aid in its demise. I long to see the light at the end of this long and dark tunnel; a light which may not cure this diseased world but at least will bring some smidgen of hope. Perhaps, it pays not to dwell too much on the bigger picture. At least by writing about mundane events in my life I can still believe that life is normal. So while the world goes on about war and other crisis, I shall create a nice little bubble to live in, and be happy for the small things in life, because that is my way of dealing with all that pain.

Paradiso Perduto (Lost Paradise) The beach is supposed to be a paradise, a place where one can relax and be one with nature. Sadly, it is not possible to do that anymore. The beach is now crowded with beachgoers who bring all their inconsiderate behaviour with them. Cycling along the tracks is akin to driving on the PIE, no, actually it's much worst. No one drives on the wrong side of the road on the PIE, but people will not hesitate to cycle on the wrong side. Why?? Doesn't it make more sense to follow the direction painted on the track? It is less hassling to keep to one side of the tracks because one wouldn't have to worry abt the on-coming traffic. But NO. It is also a wonder how people can ignore the cyclist who rings his bell to ask them to move a side. [groan] Many a time I did that, people (usually KIDS!) just start back blankly at me and REFUSED to move! Hey pal, this is the cycling track, if you're walking stay on YOUR side of the track. I actually told them off. I really did. The joy of cycling died that day. The next time I cycle, I'd make sure I wouldn't do it on a weekend, or even during the day. I'd do it at night, on a day where there would be less people. The beach is supposed to be a paradise. I wonder when did it all go wrong.

Shall I Compare Thee, (Sonnet XVIII) Shall I compare thee to a Summer's day? Thou are more lovely and more temperate: Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May, And Summer's lease hath all too short a date: Sometime too hot the eye of heaven shines, And often is his gold complexion dimm'd; And every fair from fair sometime declines, By chance or nature's changing course untrimm'd: But thy eternal Summer shall not fade Nor lose possession of that fair thou ow'st; Nor shall Death brag thou wander'st in his shade, When in eternal lines to time thou grow'st: So long as men can breathe, or eyes can see, So long lives this, and this gives life to thee. William Shakespeare

The Great Equalizer Writing about sleeping on the mrt got me thinking and I realised that the MRT is the great equalizer. One can have a PhD and can still behave like the ah-beng who didn't get his O level cert. It doesn't matter who you are or what you look like, your behaviour on the MRT makes you equal with every other passenger there. Notice how before the train reaches the station, everyone will wait anxiously in front of the station door, despite the yellow sign demarking the area to stand. Businessmen stand side by side with the coffeeshop auntie. All having the same intention: to get through the door as soon as possible and zoom in on a seat. Once the train door opens, it's every man for himself. Thin, fat, tall, short, old or young, no one actually cares. It's a dog eat dog world out there. Everyone wants a seat and the fastest one will get it. I especially hate the ladies (usually they are ladies) who literally push themselves in and barge their way to a seat. Notice also how not many are willing to give up their seat to the elderly or the pregnant lady. There are a few exceptions to that but the majority will just turn a blind eye towards it. Many people have different tactics to ignoring them. Some pretend to sleep, some feign ignorance but others, others just stare back blankly as if daring the old man or pregnant lady to shove them off their seat. Oh man.. and the kids. That is my main gripe. Kids who swing from bar to bar and use the pole as an obstacle course. Worst still, parents that ignore them. Whoever said that kids are cute obviously haven't been on the mrt, cos they are at their least cutest there. I think kids will purposely wait to get on the train before they let loose the monster that possessed them. I've seen kids screaming, kids crying, kids screaming some more and kids doing every un-cute thing they can think of. [shudder]

Sleeping in my car(riage) I love observing people on the mrt. It makes good fodder for enterainment and gives me something to write about. No prizes for guessing what I'm going to write about today. Yes, sleeping on the train. From experience, I can tell you that sleeping on the train is extremely uncomfortable. One can hardly find a good "spot" to lean against, unless one doesn't mind leaning against the oily glass at the sides. More often than not, people will usually lean back against back glass or keep their heads straight. Deep in sleep, people will hardly realise what they are doing. So, occasionally, you'll get those who end up leaning precariously on one side, encroaching his/her neighbor's space. Their heads usually bob up and down and when they lean too far to one side, they'd automatically jerk back to position, only to start leaning once they've positioned themselves properly. I've encountered some of those people and depending on my mood, sometimes, I'd usually just let them lean against me. I can remember one incident where a plus-sized man was leaning against me. It was gross cos he was snoring at the same time. Haha.. i didn't know how to get him back into place without being rude. So what I did was to slowly nudge him upright with my body. Yeah, i pushed against him and he was startled by the sudden movement. With a nice little grunt, he sat upright and promptly fell asleep again. People also sleep with their mouths open and sometimes snore. It's very interesting to observe them.

Sightings As I was walking around in Orchard the other night, I noticed something about Singaporean women. They are awfully thin! Whoever said that obesity was on the rise got his facts wrong! Almost every woman/lady had thighs half the size of mine. They, in their hipsters and itsy bitsy tops, walking on their small feet. How I envied them, me with my big thighs and hips. People tell me that big hips are good for childbirth. That's fine and good IF I was pregnant now or REMOTELY thinking of getting pregnant. But I'm not and a big hip is the last thing I need in my life. So anyway, I also noticed that Singaporean women look much better than the men. Haha, sorry guys, but that's the truth. I am sure that there are very good looking men out there but in general, the average woman looks better than the average man. In that sense, the males are lucky cos they have a wide range of women to date whereas, the women have a limited choice of men. ;p (hmm.. maybe that's why I'm still unattached....haha.. NOT! ).

Another poem. This time it's not sad, (like the first one) nor funny (like the second). This one is by Yeats, and one of my favorites as well. He Wishes for the Cloths of Heaven Had I the heavens' embroidered cloths, Enwrought with golden and silver light, The blue and the dim and the dark cloths Of night and light and the half-light, I would spread the cloths under your feet: But I, being poor, have only my dreams; I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly because you tread on my dreams W. B. Yeats

The "Infamous" Speech Winner of Documentary Film - Bowling for Columbine (In memory of the Columbine High School Shooting) ACCEPTANCE SPEECH Michael Moore : Whoa. On behalf of our producers Kathleen Glynn and Michael Donovan from Canada, I'd like to thank the Academy for this. I have invited my fellow documentary nominees on the stage with us, and we would like to  they're here in solidarity with me because we like nonfiction. We like nonfiction and we live in fictitious times. We live in the time where we have fictitious election results that elects a fictitious president. We live in a time where we have a man sending us to war for fictitious reasons. Whether it's the fictition of duct tape or fictition of orange alerts we are against this war, Mr. Bush. Shame on you, Mr. Bush, shame on you. And any time you got the Pope and the Dixie Chicks against you, your time is up. Thank you very much.
Overheard Someone pronounced "Virginia Woolf" as " VAGINA Woolf"

THE OSCARS [Grand music] The time has come for the yearly wayang* -festival... the Oscars. This time, I managed to watch the entire event without having to dash off to class. Highlights Nicole looked HOT (screw tom cruise for divorcing her), Adrian Brody totally frenched Halle Berry, some fat guy who won the short film award started critising Bush, amidst cheers and jeers from the audience, Peter O'Toole is still alive, so is Kirk Douglas (i'm sure both of them are on the wrong side of 90 by now), Steve Martin was funny, Sean Connery was wearing this odd suit, J.Lo was nicely covered up in a lime green dress, Adrian Brody won for best actor, Nicole for Best Actress, Chicago for Best Movie and Roman Polanski for Best Director and the biggest surprise, in my opinion, was that Eminem won the song of the year award. Who looked hot? - NICOLE KIDMAN * another term for "over the top"

More couple tales I've not written on this for quite some time now, mainly cos i've not seen anything worth writing about. But tonight is a different story. I was on the MRT, on my way back to school, when a couple walked in. There were not so many couples in that carriage tonight, so it was easier to observe them. Are all couples by nature very clingy? Not emotionally, (who can tell if a couple is emotionally clingy?), but physically. This girl had her hands wrapped around one of her boyfriend's arms. But of course, he didn't exactly discourage her from doing that. This was obvious because when they sat down, he placed that particular arm on her side of the chair. Do you get what i mean? Let me try to describe it. He was sitting on her left. She was clinging on to his right arm. So, that right arm was placed on the chair on her right. Geddit? That's not the grossest part. The grossest part was when they started scratching each other. That was funny. I've never seen couples scratch one another in public before. At first she was just rubbing her hands over his arm (yes the arm that she was clinging to). I suppose she was feeling his muscles at the same time (he had very nice biceps, if i must say so). He, in turn, used his free hand, ie his left hand, to rub whichever arm that was closest to him. So, they looked like they were trap in a blizzard and the only way to keep warm was to rub their arms. And so the scratching begins. As one of his hands was "trapped" by the vine that is her arm, he could not scratch the itch that appeared on his left (free) arm. And you know what he did? He pointed to it, and she happily scratched it. It was not a fervent scratching like one would do for a bad itch, but it was more, rubbing with nails. Rub rub rub, she went. Then he pointed to another itch that conveniently appeared on the trapped arm, and she scratched that for him. You know what they reminded me of? Ever seen chimps scratching each other, looking for fleas? Yeah, that's what they reminded me of. It was funny and disgusting at the same time. Thank goodness they were on the train for about a few stops only. Haha..

Tales of the Funny Singapore International Comedy Festival - Ross Noble in "Sonic Waffle" Review time! I went for a stand up comedy show last night by Ross Noble from the UK. This is his 2nd time in Singapore for the Comedy Fest and I must admit I went for the first one as well. Long story as to why my friends and I went for his show again. Anyway, he is slightly better this time round as compared to two years ago. His jokes are more slapstick and dumb as opposed to being witty. He is funny, but not as funny as the first stand-up comedian that came 5 years ago (I forgot his name, but man, that guy was HILARIOUS). If you like jokes about how man can milk cows while drivng (long story, don't ask) then you'd enjoy the show. He did recycle some of his jokes though.. something about "hair" and "humidity" and things you say when you're having sex.

Say What? With all the talk about the war, I found a new word that i like. I like the sound of it. " blitzkrieg " - A swift, sudden military offensive, usually by combined air and mobile land forces. Of German origin. To lighten the mood, i'll be going for a comedy festival show tonight (woohoo!). Will do a recap when I'm back.
It has begun............

Oh what a night! Oh what a night it was. We were supposed to have our post-FYP celebration tonight. After much debate about the choice of clubs, we decided to try out a new place instead of our usual Wednesday haunt. Boy, what a mistake that turned out to be. Our first choice had potentially good music but nobody was dancing. Apparently, Wednesdays are reserved for drinking and not dancing. We then decided to go back to our usual place, as good music was a given and the crowd would be on their feet the whole night through. However, certain establishments are just so anal that they would not allow a person in without proper identification, despite futile attempts to convince them otherwise. [As you can see, the night isn't going so well for us right now]. We then decided to go to a new place which has been deemed as "hip" and "happening". ID was not a problem and we soon figured out why. But first, upon reaching the inner sanctum of the club, we had to purchase our drink before we entered. The place was almost empty, save for a few people milling around and smoking. ID was not a problem namely because they needed the crowd to keep their cash registers ringing. The music was not of our taste, ie alot of drums and bass and no lyrics. [If I were high, I could have danced, but since I don't drink, that was going to be a non-occurring event.] The management was very smart. They made patrons buy their first drink before entering so that even if they were to leave, they would have already spent at least $10 on drinks. Sigh, we left soon after finishing our drinks. Oh dear, it was already a quarter to 1 and still no place to go. But we persevered. We returned to our original choice to see if the crowd was better. It was, but no one was dancing on the dance floor and the music had degenerated to more drum and bass. [What's with that?] Ok. This was getting tiring. So many clubs in one location and yet there was no where else to go! Some places were even empty! Finally, we chanced upon a place that had a lot of people. And, gosh, there were lots of people. So far so good. The music was good and people were dancing. After much squeezing, we found ourselves a choice location on the dance floor. But the inevitable happened: Mr Drum and Bass appeared. [Groan] By this time, we had more or less given up hope of actually enjoying ourselves. We left the joint at half past 2 and headed straight for Fong Seng's. Oh what a night.......

MORE MOVIE REVIEWS (oh god noooooooooooooooooooooo!) 3) Hot Chicks Another lame-brained movie starring Rob Schneider (what's with him and B-grade flicks?). In case you don't know, he's the guy who acted in Deuce Bigelow, Male Gigolo . So 'nuff said. You know what kind of movie this is. Cheerleader, prom-queen-wannabe, ms diva is like so popular in school and she has like all her posse with her like all the time. Like totally. And like she bought this cool earrings from this like African-ish store. What she doesn't know is like the earrings have the ability to swap the identities of the wearer. Like if I were to wear one, and you like wore the other one, our identities would like swtich. Like isn't that cool? [The paragraph above must be said in a bimbo voice] So, anyway, Ms Prom here and her friends banged into some guy and they dropped all their shopping [gasp!] including the earrings. So blah blah blah, Ms Prom wore one earring, so did the guy (wtf? why wld a guy wear 1 earring? it's not even a stud. it's one of those horrendously ornate earrings that dangle). They swapped identities.. and it all goes downhill from there. Ratings: Never going to watch it again. Luckily I didn't watch this at the cinema.

2) Daredevil This is another movie that I didn't watch fully. And it's got nothing to do with the language barrier. This movie just sucked. I didn't like it. I watched the first 50 mins and skipped all the way to the last 10 mins. There's nothing much to say. Blind guy becomes superhero. Miraculously, he falls for CUTE, HOT gal, while fighting the villains of the world, namely Kingpin and Bullseye. See, even the names sound corny. Kingpin? What kind of name is that? And why is he so lucky as to be able to catch himself a HOT CHICK? huh? Why can't he fall for a gal who looks like Robert Schneider in "Hot Chicks" (another review coming soon)?? Sheesh.. Ok actors: Blind guy is Ben Affleck (the guy who can't act) Hot gal - Jennifer Garner (and boy is she HOT) Kingpin - Michael Duncan Clark or was it Michael Clark Duncan? (The green mile freak) Bullseye - Collin Farrel (Irish hunk, who's not so hunky in this show) Ratings: Puhleeze, I couldn't even finish watching the download.

Ok more Reviews (i'm on a roll here) Some of you may wonder what the hell do I do with my time since I seem to be reviewing alot of movies lately. I'm not as free as you may like to think. I watch all these movies over lunch/dinner or any meals I have whenever I'm in hall. :) 1) 8 Femmes (8 Women) As much as i'd like to review this show, I can't. First, I've not finished watching the show. Secondly, the reason why I've not finished watching the show is cos I don't understand it. This show is in French and while the quality of the download is incredibly good (it's a DVDrip, btw), it has no friggin subtitles. It's a headache to follow their dialogue. I gave it my best shot. I lasted abt half of the show before I gave up cos my head was pounding. This show isn't like Taxi (another French movie) where one can rely on the actions to understand the movie. Au contraire , this movie is similar to Gosford Park, a movie where dialogue is tres importante (very important). My French is very rusty, it has to be. The last time I had to listen to unsubtitled French was when I was in France, donkey years ago. So, what I managed to gather from the show: It's actually a good show, very campy but not in a cheesy sorta way. The characters are all women and the plot is: The patriach was killed one snowy morning. Who killed him? Is it his powerful but unhappy wife? Or one of his two daughters? Or is it his mother-in-law? It could also be his spinster sister-in-law. Don't forget there are 2 housekeepers who may have a reason to kill that bastard. Then, there is the sudden appearance of his sister.... Each of them have a motive. But only one killed him. I don't know who's the killer, neither have i figured out exactly what their motives are. There are light hearted segments found in the show, namely all those songs that each character has to perform. It's hilarious.
Stupid quiz time How many times did i write "cute" in the last review? No prizes though. Unless you want a hug from me.

Movie Review How To Lose A Guy In 10 Days (Chick Flick alert!!!) This movie isn't out yet. :) Thanks to the wonders of Kazaa, one can now watch it esp if one does not want to throw $6.50 down the drain. If you think this movie is a romantic comedy, then Ding! you're right! This movie stars Kate Hudson ("Almost Famous", spawn of Goldie Hawn) and Matthew McConaughey ("The Wedding Planner", I dunno who his parents are). It's a cute, fluffy, feel good show. No braincells are needed to enjoy the movie. Sigh. Must I get into the details of the plot? Naw.. Not gonna. Kate Hudson is a delight. She's cute and perky but not annoying like Reese Witherspoon in "Legally Blonde" or "Sweet Home Alabama", shows which I've (unfortunately) watched. Matthew McConaughey isn't what I'd call a typical romantic hero but he can carry his role well enough. Unlike most shows, there is only ONE sex scene! Think you heard wrong? No. There really is only ONE sex seen and the most one would see is a bare shoulder. No boobies, no mid-riffs. Surprising eh? The supporting cast add to the laughs as well. However, not much screen time is given to each of them. I barely remembered their (real and reel) names. The typical ingredients for a romantic comedy are all there: The cute/lovable main characters with their odd, romantically challenged best friends, the light soundtrack, the cute but weird-looking pet and more lovable people. It's all sunshine and happiness over in la-la land people, so pack your bags and get ready for the trip. This show, like its predecessors, is enjoyable but utterly forgettable. Ratings: I'd watch it, only if someone paid for it.

Pictures We (no, it's actually just me) could be blackmailed with..... Things ppl do on a Fri nite while sitting in a bar... How hip. Oh gosh... it's my walrus shot. haha... It's Corinne!!! :) Bhavish with his "Whatever lah" pose. He thinks he is so cool.. WHATEVER.

Sights and Sounds I was out today. It was a bad idea though. Never go out on a Sunday especially during the school holidays. I had a simple plan: Go to Suntec and have a look at the IT fair. Sounded simple right? But it seemed that every other Singaporean had the same plan as well. At Suntec, I was surrounded by all those aunties, uncles, yuppie types, couples, expats, tourists and of course KIDS. Everyone was heading to the 4th floor of the Convention Centre. I could feel the beginnings of a headache. It was going to be a loooooong afternoon. The IT Fair was packed like sardines. No, not even sardines, it was even worst. If a fire broke out, I swear, there would be a stampede. Going to the fair, one wouldn't know that Singapore is in the midst of a recession looking how people were just merrily spending their money away. "Ooh, let's buy a printer," says one. "Nah, how about a digicam?," says the other. First one says, "How about both?" "Sure!" says No 2. That's just a hypothetical conversation between 2 people but it sure conveys the buying atmosphere there. Tons of people were carting around huge boxes, Lexmark, Olympus, HP, Acer and lots of other brands. If I had $1,788 I would have gotten myself the 12" Ibook. Such a bargain and it looks soooo pretty. Aesthetically very pleasing. But alas, some people aren't just born with a silverspoon in her mouth. I left the fair partly cos I was suffocating in there and partly cos I've done all the sightseeing I wanted to do. The rest of Suntec was just as crowded, unfortunately for me. 1 place wasn't very crowded though, the Times bookstore. Haha.. Singaporeans aren't big fans of reading I suppose.

But at least it's all over as well!!! I am one happy gal now.

This new hair cut isn't as short as my previous ones (for those who know me for a long time, u'll know that i love cutting my hair as short as possible). Nope. This new hairdo is a la meg ryan's. Long Live the Mac Yes, it's been awhile, but I am finally posting something, to demonstrate solidarity with all Mac fans... It is time the world revolted against the tyranny of Microsoft.. too long have we been held in captivity by the Gates, forced to suffer blue screens, infestations of bugs, and poor surfing conditions... too long have we been fooled by updates that promise to end our misery but in fact, cause more... too long, too long have users been crushed under the weight of unreasonably priced software that promises to crash at the very first use... It is time... power to the people... we have the right to long computer life, liberty from frozen PCs and the pursuit of happy, stress-free computer activity... Give me a Mac and give me death to Microsoft!

Attack of the stupid computers (and stupid computer users) Ok sorry for ranting here, but well, it is a mundane rant. So anyway, my friend bought a PC right? And it got here on Friday. Yesterday (Saturday) it was already f*cking up and doing stupid things and bringing up those little messages it does to annoy the hell out of you. And it does this when she does the smallest things! Like resizing her IE window. Hell, it does it when she opens IE! Its so dumb! And it keeps saying "do you want to report this to Microsoft?" What the hell man. Shouldn't Microsoft test drive its bloody products before shipping them out? I mean surely, getting IE up and running without driving the rest of the computer completely beserk is quite essential . It is afterall a web browser, and the first thing most people do when they get a computer is usually to surf the web, check email etc. I was over in her room trying to "fix" the problem. This on the second day they don't even bother giving you a grace period of a week anymore. The programme just comes with holes and bugs and you're expected to "fix it" by downloading updates and by "reporting problems to Microsoft". Meanwhile, the ctrl+alt+del button is already worn out... THIS is why I use a Mac. It may not be 100% compatible with a windows network (ala NUS), but stuff that! Why would I want to be compatible with something that crashes with the click of a mouse? I don't have to download 21 updates when I first installed my new OS. In fact, I think it was more like 3 updates. I have to pay for Mac support? Stuff that too! I can ask other mac users and they'll probably have an answer to my question or at least know where to look for an answer. Better than calling the resident computer guy, who of course, will "fix" the problem on the PC, (which always comes back later) and strangely, he doesn't know how he fixed it either. Dodgy anybody? Sure, my mac freezes from time to time, but I find that that only seems to happen when I'm using Office programmes like word, and excel, which are of course, quality Microsoft products (yes we do have MS Office for Macs, and Microsoft seems to think that Office runs better on a Mac than on their windows counterpart, they look better, I'll give you that!). So in conclusion, Microsoft should stop shipping crap, and stop making people pay money for the crap they ship. Its no wonder people go for pirated versions. I mean seriously, if I had paid US$199.95 for something that drives me insane, I'd be pretty damned pissed! That is my rant. I'm going back to sleep now.

Awww.. chin up! I guess, it's to coincide with the OSCARS!! (aka wayang festival) In the meantime, make do with dysfunctional tests and whatever lah, cos frankly my dear, i don't give a damn .

my two cents My two cents, don't worry, i've got lots to spare. I would normally wait, which is my usual stand in situations like these. But I'm no expert, seeing as I'm not in any relationship right now and my "wait and see" approach has been operating at a 100% failure rate. So I guess, my advice here shouldn't be taken at all. heh.. I think going with the flow is a conservative approach. I'm sure you could just jump in and declare your undying affection towards her, but that would just scare her away wouldn't it? You could shake a "magic 8-ball" if you can find one of those here and ask the all important question: "should i tell her?" Maybe hinting is a good way. Girls are more receptive to hints than guys. Haha. I think with a guy, even if you drop a 1-tonne hint, it would never work. You can hint yourself to death, and he still wouldn't get it. But that's a different story altogether. Anyway, this is just my opnion. In other news I lost one of my earrings just now. Bleah, how sad. First my pencil now my earring. Gotta get myself a new pair now.

The case of the ex Do you still have artefacts from previous relationships lying around at home? I do. Not because I want to keep the memories, but because I couldn't be bothered collecting and returning them to their rightful owner. Heck, I think that if he wanted it, he could have asked me for it cos they are his things, not mine. So anyway, in light of all this SARS thing, one of the best things that I have from that relationship is a thermometer. Hee.. it's one of those digital thermometers. So fun taking my temperature whenever I'm home. Haha, good thing that the ex's dad is a doctor.

Hence, the splurge on food. Which brings us to now. :) Going to take my shower soon but not before I gripe about my pencil. I lost it. My favourite (actually, my only) blue pencil. I had a mild scare sometime during the semester, but it was a false alarm. This time, however, I really lost it. It went missing last week and I wanted to buy the exact one however, Popular Jurong Point didn't carry that particular type of pencil. I wonder why. So anyway, I bought this reasonably priced (ok ok, it was cheap-o lah. About $1.50) pencil which totally died on me the next day. Some metal thing came out of the tip of the pencil and the lead kept breaking. To cut the long story short, I went to Popular Tampines last night to buy my original pencil. And do you know how much it cost? $3.90!! That's close to four friggin' dollars! How can that be possible? It's like a meal already. To top it all off, they didn't carry the colour I wanted! I had to buy a yellow one cos the pink was just too PINK But, at least now I have my pencil back. hee...

Dear dream chaser , Your soliloquy was touching. The criteria we have for our dreamguy/girl are just guidelines to aid in looking for or choosing the most suitable person for ourselves. Just like rules, such criteria can be thrown down the drain in any event one finds an "unsuitable" girl/guy attractive and would like to give "it" a shot. Some people just hold on to the criteria/guidelines/benchmark tighter than others. Criteria or rather lack of criteria doesn't equate to an unhappy or unsatisfying relationship. To a certain extent, having preconceived expectations about one's dreamgirl/guy limits one's choices. It is best to just enjoy the moment. You like a girl? She likes you back? All fine and well. Talk it out and see how things go. Not all attractions would end up as relationships. Don't know if you like a girl but you keep thinking about her? Then, throw out all your criteria and concentrate on the girl's attractive qualities and decide if you want to get involved with that person. Things aren't as complicated as we make them out to be. I wish you luck in your search.... :)

Dear Aunt Agony, okok... i noe im supposed to have exams on monday... but hey, Sars didnt stop my life did it? im not gonna let a coupla exams ruin my perfectly thrashy boring life filled wif routines of rotting in front of tv watching footie... well... its been a really weird study break this whole week.... didnt do much of studying as usual... ended up thinking abt various personal affairs... do the criteria we set for our dreamgal or guy actually matter? i mean, we end up getting blinded anyway when things really happen, dun we? so wats the pt of tinking abt wat we want in a guy or gal in the 1st place? okie... maybe we shld werk the other way n tink abt wat we DUN want in our partners ( as a particular guru advises me to do ;p )... i dun want my potential, future, as-yet-unfound gf to be too self-righteous n always tinking shes in the rite... even if shes rite, pls dun gloat too much... i dun want her to be too overbearing abt being smarter than me... hey, i dun mind gals who ar smarter than me... in fact, i get impressed when i meet gals who actually ar smarter than me (not in the academic sense tho it does play a small part), since it also saves me the trouble of tinking for myself... but pls dun rub it in my face... i dun want my gf to be a mugger only concerned abt studies n bks n werk... n earning the million bucks when shes 25... i dun want her to be some bimbo who i cant communicate wif... no matter wat they say, i feel dat communication has to be THE most impt factor in any r/s... from the most mundane matters in life to the most abstract... she has to understand wat im saying, n of cos, vice versa... n the mutual communication definitely has to be comfortable, enjoyable n not strained or forced... i dun want my gf to be uninterested in any sport... heck, if u dun play it, at least be excited by some kind of active sport which requires perspiring (thus bowling, 9-ball or chess doesnt count)... watching it on tv n being excited by it is fine... okie... dats abt it... dats all i DUN want my imaginary gf to be... havent toked abt looks, but i guess im not picky so long as she doesnt turn me off at 1st sight... so where does this monologue leave me? im still stuck at square 1...... lost in the darn fog, waiting to be led out of the forest by anyone who fulfills those prerequisites... im tired of chasing the dream... y cant it look for me instead?

Waiting for my hair to dry.... It's 4.50 in the morning and I'm waiting for my hair to dry before I go to sleep. Norah Jones is singing in the background, and I'm feeling clean and smelling good. Ahh, c'est la vie . Another day has gone. Came back from a so-so clubbing outing. Sigh. The golden age of clubbing is coming to an end. We had our pre-dinner drinks at Devil's Bar. Happy Hour was from 5pm to 8pm and you can get 3 mugs/jugs of Tiger beer for the price of 1. Bhavish got himself the beer at $9.50. He finished all 3 mugs by himself without puking. That guy drinks like a fish. I was happy with my virgin colada, albeit, a very tangy virgin colada. Went back to his place for dinner. Heh, parents bought Burger King for us. After which a pre-clubbing session was in order. Listened and grooved to music in his room while he read his cases. Tonight's clubbing destination: Devil's Bar again. We got our chops during happy hour so we did not have to pay again. Place was full of NS people. Crowd was friggin' young. Don't know how they all got in since security was very anal about IDs. Our trash was played sparingly. No surprises there. Dj in the dance room played alot of bad remixes. We weren't there very long. Live room was a bit better. Band played our usual trash. Dj must have used to work at Zouk on Mambo nights cos there was a mambo phase. By 1.30, we were bored. Went out for cheap-o drinks at the nearby 7-11. Ahh.. convenient stores are the greatest. Bought a huge drink and chips and sat down at the bus stop for a midnight snack. After pigging out, went back into Devil's bar to get my bag out of the locker. Took a walk to Hard Rock, but the place was empty. Strange. It's the end of the clubbing world as we know it. SN buses are fantastic. The nice uncle dropped me off in front of my bus stop again. A long hot shower was needed to rid myself from all that smoke in Devil's Bar. The crowd may have thinned, but the amount of smoke was still the same. And here I am... Waiting for my hair to dry.

AMERICAN IDOL I admit it, I love trashy shows.. and American idol (AI) is no exception. Although, I must admit, that it is sooooooo much better than the local talent time show we had. I watched that too, from the quarter-finals onwards. Never did bother with the heats. Same thing with AI. Only watched it from the q-finals and I am hooked! I love this show! I don't care about backstage drama, but boy, those people can SING. Ok. let me clarify. MOST of them can sing. After yesterday's show, we are left with 6 wannabes. They are: 1) Ruben Studdard - a BIG man, with the voice of smooth velvet. This boy can sing! A younger version of Barry WHite 2) Clay Aiken - Geeky guy. When I first saw him, I thought he wouldn't be able to sing. Heh, was blown away by his rendition of "open arms". He has proven each week that his voice is no fluke. The geekiness has won him many fans. But sometimes a bit too drama with the facial expressions. 3) Kimberly Locke - Not your typical star. First, she's on the fleshy side. But this lady has the voice of a diva. Very soulful and her renditions are more often than not, right on the money. Dressing needs some working though. Not much fan support. 4) Josh Gracin - The marine that never made it to Iraq. Popular with the American crowd, mainly cos he's a marine. Can do country renditions competently. But not a whole lot of talent. Getting fatter now that he's staying in that mansion with the rest of the contestants. 5) Trenyce - Another black singer (Kim is half black, half white). Very Diva. Dresses like one too. Has a good voice, although her performances aren't consistent. 6) Carmen Rasmuseen - Oh god. don't get me started on this girl. SHE CAN'T SING! Sounds like a goat/sheep/any farm animal. The only reason why she's been here for so long is cos of fan base. Fans vote for her and always garners enough votes to stay another week. UGH UGH UGH. Americans can be sooo stupid at times. Has this cutesy dollish face that is "in" and "commercial".

AAAAAAARGH! I HATE COMPUTERS!!! This is it. The final straw. My bloody pc is DYING on me! It restarts all by itself WHENEVER it feels like it. No warning, no message. The monitor will turn black and i can hear my CPU whirring, and Oops! It has restarted. WTF?! WHAT IS WRONG WITH IT?! The last thing I need is a computer problem. I don't know much about it and I'm not a difficult person to please. All I ask from it is for it to work, run smoothly and have no program errors. Which brings me to ICQ. I've never had ANY major problems with the ICQ program till today. For the life of me, I couldn't figure out why the ICQ program REFUSED to load! After clicking on the flower button, the image "ICQpro2003a is loading" appears and the flower appears on the task bar. AND THAT'S IT . The pgm doesn't start, the "loading" image doesn't disappear!! I went for a nap and when I woke up, it was STILL like that! WHY??? OH GOD WHY??????? WHAT DID I DO TO DESERVE SUCH MUTINY FROM COMPUTERS AND THEIR RELATED PROGRAMS? I've never had this problem before! Then I thought, fine, nevermind, switch to ICQlite. I've had a problem with ICQLite for some time now, but i decided to give it a shot. To prevent any problems from taking place, I uninstalled ICQlite and re download the pgm and re-installed it. Smooth sailing so far. Clicked on icqlite. Ahh.. my contact list was all there. BUT when I tried to send a message, the stupid windows said that ICQlite had an error. WHAT ERROR? WHY? OH WHY? And so, I had to CLOSE my icqlite pgm. Undeterred, I tried again. I uninstalled Icqlite and repeated the WHOLE process. The error log still appaered. I was at my wits end. Then I tried uninstalling IcqPro and reinstalling it again. This time, there was an error with one file even before i clicked on the flower!! AAAAAAAARGHHHHHHHHHHHH! And so, now, i'm using WEB-BASED icq which is totally RIDICULOUS considering that I SHOULD be able to use BOTH icqlite and icqpro. DEATH to pcs and Icq. I want the iBOOK NOW .

Voice from the past Ok not really, but its been awhile since I've said anything, and usually, I save my postings to quality comments (HAHA) but seeing how that has yet to happen, what the hell, its a blog for mundane things right? Anyway, its been a crappy week, tests and assignments galore. I need a nice long sleep after that ordeal, and I got that last night when I fell asleep at 9 and got up at 8 this morning. Everyone is leaving for Easter Break! They have it so good here, Easter goes from Friday to Monday. Yes, they have an Easter Monday after Easter Sunday. Its a weird concept. Why would anyone need a holiday after a religious holiday? My answer to this is the drinking and revelry that goes on (I would like to say behind closed doors, but its done quite publicly, with no pretenses about being sober on the day Jesus supposedly died). There's an Easter Party tonight, with "Easter Slammers" and "Cheap Drinks". Hello? I know Jesus turned water into wine, but I'm sure this was not what he had in mind... Maybe I'm missing something here, but that's supposedly the life of a college student: Beer and loud music, oh and passing out in the hallway... But well I don't know too much about Easter, and even less about where the Easter Bunny came into the picture, so I'll just enjoy the extra day of rest.

So what would you do if you had $53 million? Don't ask why I thought of the question. It's a long story, and involves alot of bitching. Hee. So what would you do if you had 53 million smackeroos? I would shop. Yeah I totally would shop. Not for clothes, but for houses. I've thought it through. I want a villa in Greece, a log cabin (3 separate buildings, including a barn) in Canada, a loft apartment in New York, and a bed and breakfast inn in France. I also would love a ski cabin and a ranch, but I shan't be greedy. I would still live in Singapore. Would love to own one of those colonial bungalows they have here. Then I'd get myself a Lear jet. So that I can fly from one home to another. Heh.. I've not thought of other things to buy at all. Am pretty hung up over the idea of owning homes in almost all the continents on earth. Not into those fancy cars as well. Too small, although they look really gorgeous. Ahh.. who says money can't buy happiness?

METZ ooh.. Went to Metz for the second time last night. A place where I actually liked and don't mind doing a review on it. It's located at the Gallery Hotel, very near Liquid Room. The place is cozy with seats and sofas surrounding the dance floor. The resident band "Energy" plays a mixture of alternative and pop every night. They are pretty good and can sing well. Requests can be made of course, but no guarantees that they would play it. We requested John Mayer's Your Body is A Wonderland each time we went there, but they have yet to fulfill our request. Seats are comfortable. It is advisable to make a reservation first so that the seats would be available. We had a choice spot, right at the corner, away from the dance floor and the smoke. The volume of the music was, unfortunately, very loud such that screaming was necessary in order to be heard over the din. Mocktails were good and affordable, at $10 a glass. The drinks came in fancy cocktail glasses with cute stems.

Woohoo! The 9th season of "Friends" is back on Channel 5! I love that show and have more or less followed the happenings of Ross, Rachel, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe and Joey since day 1, donkey years ago. I've been through breakups, clumsy moments, marriage and recently, a pregnancy with them. I love all of them, although my absolute favourite has got to be Chandler. We have so much in common: we are funny, sarcastic and fun to be with. Heee.... Yesterday's episode was "The One Where No One Proposed", not their best episode but it ends the cliff-hanger from last season. Another show that is back on 5 is "Gilmore Girls" at a weird time slot: Sunday 6pm. Now who the hell puts good tv shows at this time of the day? No one is ever home to watch it! Sometimes, Mediacorp can do the stupidest things. Quality dramas like Gilmore Girls, The Agency (heh, another favourite) and Judging Amy are scheduled at godawful times. But crapshit shows like The Bachelor and Meet the Folks are given prime slots during the week. Like excuuuuuuuuse me. Reality shows like The Amazing Race, Survivor and maybe American Idol are fine. At least they are interesting, although all the contestants are media whores at heart. But The Bachelor and Meet the Folks? I've not watched MTF, but I did catch some episodes of first season of TB (read all abt my recaps in previous posts). Who cares about women chasing after a man? Taste is a very subjective matter. I mean, old shows like "Indiana Jones" are fun! I don't know why they don't show Indiana Jones at all. Oh. And this week, we have "Peter Benchley's Creature". I am absolutely convinced that the movie was shown last year. Freaky B-list movie about sharks with hands. UGH. And let's not forget the Seagal/Stallone/Swarzeneggar/Van Damme-type shows on Mondays. I want my cable baaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaack!

Get Over You.. I always find the topic of relationships interesting to talk about. Mainly cos it's so fun to diss couples.. but that's another story altogether. The purpose of this post is to find out when is the appropriate time to date once a person has broken up with his/her ex. When a couple has been going together for 2 years and then decide to break up, would being part of a new relationship within 3 months be appropriate? I guess then, the amount of time needed to recover from the failed relationship is proportionate to the amount of emotions involved? But then again, maybe people have different reasons for getting attached - for companionship, security, to boost one's ego, to look "cool", to cling on to another person, and a whole load of other reasons. If one's source of security (assuming that security is the reason) is lost, then it is logical to look for another one as soon as possible. Wouldn't it be exhausting then, to have to start from scratch - The getting to know you bit, the phone calls, the reporting, the having to meet with that person all the time, basically the entire courtship routine? I don't know. After having a fuss-free life for so long, I feel exhausted just thinking of all the couple rituals one must go through when being part of a couple. And the very idea of having to repeat it all over soon after ending a relationship baffles me.

Movie Review - Fight Club I didn't intend to download this movie. In fact, I was actually looking for Taxi 3. However, with kazaa, one has to always remember that the file names aren't accurate. Taxi 3 (divx) was Fight Club. This movie was released in 1999 and stars Brad Pitt (so hot!) and Edward Norton (so hot!). The plot is basic, 2 guys decided to form the Fight Club, a club where ordinary men would come together and beat each other into a pulp. The fight scenes are gory. No CGI effects a la LOTR but just the bare essentials: 2 half naked men and their fists. The twist at the end was surprising, although it tied the movie up, I was still a little puzzled as there were small loopholes which can't be explained. (Or maybe I was just too lazy to dwell on them.) Anyway, the 2 main leads are good. I've never been a great big fan of Brad Pitt but he was flawless in the movie as the brash, confident and sexually-unsatiable, Tyler Durton. Edward Norton was also superb as Jack (I think), the quiet, confused insomniac. The dialogue is witty and the overall feel of the movie is dark and disturbing. I liked it. Ratings: I wld have definitely paid up to $8 for it.

Courtesy of the letter C i've been cajoled, coaxed, and downright coerced into composing this... i shall not cite names... im concerned enough about too many other things to care about losing my life as well SARS has utterly crushed any social life i had that had always been conducted indoors in close confined spaces. no Cleo party at Zouk... n paranoid-mummy-curfew has confirmed my absence from movie theatres, crowded restaurants etc for the foreseeable future... if we were in Iraq now, im certain i'd have been covered wif sand 6 feet undergrd by her juz in case i got cuffed by a bomb... anyway... except the verbs "to be" and "have", all my verbs have commenced with the letter C. No letter Cs were caused harm in the process.

I love my SN uncles The SN bus service is a weekday miracle. Wonderful for those coming back late on weekdays and don't want to waste money on cab fares. For 3 bucks, the SN uncle would drive you to the bus stop along the route. It works just like a Night Rider, except that the service is slightly more personal because the bus is smaller. FYI, it's a Bus Plus. The past 2 times i took the bus, i've been lucky to be the last person on the bus. Cos then the uncle would drop me as close to NTU as possible. The first time, the uncle dropped off at the entrance, before he turned to the highway. The 2nd time, the nice uncle (a different uncle) actually went in NTU and dropped off at the hall bus stop! :)

Fashion faux pas It amuses me sometimes to see the fairer sex fall prey to fashion. What's in right now? Hipster jeans. Unfortunately, not everyone can look good in a pair of hipster jeans. Just cos hipster jeans are in, doesn't mean that EVERYONE has to wear one. I don't wear one, mainly cos i look absolutely horrendous in it. I've tried. When i was at Orchard on Tuesday, I saw a girl wearing hipster jeans. One advice, if you wear hipster jeans, wear underwear, or at the very least a thong. Her jeans was soooooo low that she spent most of her time trying to pull that damn thing up. Whenever it slipped down, i could see her butt crack. I'm not kidding. I really saw her butt crack. It was NOT a pleasant sight, i can assure you. If she was thin, it may not be so bad, but she's on the fleshy side, not plump, just fleshy and seeing a fleshy butt is not good for the eyes or mind. I guess if i saw a thong, like those sexy triumph ones, it'll at least be kinky... but that sight was plain awful. I felt like going up to her and tell her to cover that up, but she was with her bf and i do not wish to incur his wrath, especially since i was by myself at that time.

Good news? or Bad news? Exams have been postponed by 2 wks in NTU! It has finally been confirmed this evening. It's quite a drag cos then everything has to be pushed forward by 2 wks. It is also odd to postpone exams but not cancel class. I mean, if the reason for the postponement was due to the SARS outbreak, wouldn't it make more sense to shut classes instead? Exams would still be postponed in the end. The reason given for the postponement was to allow quarantined students sufficient time to study. Hello? Doesn't anyone realise that those under quarantine would have more time to study because they can't go anywhere? It's admirable to see the newly inaugarated president take some action to build a good rapport with the student body. I don't fully know what the forum held on tuesday was all about but it seemed as though he made the decision to postpone the exams without consulting the academic board (if there is one). On the whole, the postponement means that i don't have to suffer from last minute panic attacks due to a lack of time to prepare for exams. However, it also means that i can't give the usual "no time to study" excuse. heh.

MOVIE REVIEW Ok ok. i don't think i'm invincible, but i've been dying to watch a movie for the longest time. The SARS outbreak didn't deter me, although i was abit worried. Thankfully no one coughed in the cinema. Anyway, i watched "Adaptation" last night. Err.. it's a plot-less movie, in my opinion. Slow and somewhat entertaining at certain points. Nicholas Cage was good, portraying the life of Charles and Donald Kaufman, twin scriptwriters. Meryl Streep plays the author who's book Charles is trying to write a screenplay about. Chris Cooper, who plays the main character in Meryl's book, won the Oscar for Best Supporting Actor. Apparently the movie is supposed to be a comedy. It is funny and the dialogue can be witty at times. But I feel that the ending killed it for me. All that unnecessary drama was just plain UNNECESSARY. Rating: 6.50 just cos it's an "arty" show.

BLAH! WAR! DISEASE! All very attention-grabbing headlines. In the past week, we have been pounded with extensive coverage of the WAR! and SARS! Let it be known that I am fully against the war on moral grounds, lest ppl may think that religion plays a factor. This constant yabbering about freeing the Iraqi people is a load of bull. No one is that altruistic. It is easy to destroy a country, but rebuilding it is a daunting task. (i shall stop my rants here. there would be too much to write and i'm too tired of talking about it) The outbreak is a more pressing problem. What is the world coming to? It's all ending... it really is... We live in a sick, sick world.

For those who actually care I cut my hair! It's so neat. I look like a secondary school girl. I miss my Meg Ryan hairdo. *sob* Told the lady that I wanted my hair length to be below the ear with slight layering. She totally layered it and is now a layered bob. She absolutely butchered my hair with all that frantic layering and snipping. I was amazed that I had that much hair! I had to keep my emotions under wraps. There was no point in telling her that I didn't like it cos she had already snipped half my hair. My earrings got caught in her comb a couple of times. heh. That always happens. I ought not to wear such loopy earrings. *grin* I didn't like my hair cut at first (like it wasn't obvious from all that ranting I've done in the above paragraph), but now, I have gotten quite used to it. Anyway, there's nothing much I can do about it cos it's already so short. I have to let it grow out and when it starts to curl out, I have to cut it again. It does feel good to have short hair once again, especially in this awful, awful weather. Not that it was ever long, but it was irritating with all that hair around my neck.

AMERICAN IDOL The finale of American Idol was shown on Thursday. I had been eagerly anticipating it since like forever. And I'm sure you know by now that Ruben is the new American Idol by a mere 130,000 votes. Feelings and opinions I wasn't blown away by their performances. I missed Ruben's first song and came back only in time to watch Clay perform. I actually liked his first song. Simon was right, it was a tad too musical-y. But you have to admit it, Clay's voice is perfect for that kind of music. I would cringe if he attempted to oversing a Justin Timberlake song, for example. Ruben did a great rendition of Imagine and I didn't like Clay's second song. It was sooo boring, much like his rendition of Vincent . For their 3rd song, Ruben chose Flying Without Wings and Clay did Bridge Over Troubled Waters . Let me just say this, I can't believe Ruben chose a WESTLIFE song! AArgh! That's a point against him. Clay did a FAANTASTIC rendition of Simon & Garfunkel's famous song. I wasn't surprised by Ruben's win. Whoever won didn't actually matter cos they have all gotten recording contracts. Clay should be on a stage in a musical. This is not a criticism. I simply cannot imagine him singing a pop song, especially songs that are specifically catered for teens. Ruben may be more "marketable" in that sense. Results show Ohmigod. It was 2 hours of fluff. It was nice to see all the finalists on stage, sans Corey and Josh. I loved the recaps of all those tone deaf people. Dammit. I could have been one of them. hahah.. my 2 mins of fame. I should have watched the show from the very beginning of the season just to hear them try to "sing". Edgar Nova aka Enrique-gone-wrong was hilarious!!! He absolutely tickled me, almost as much as Keith aka Madonna-gone-wrong.

Movie Review - MATRIX: RELOADED My first movie since the end of the exams! And, I DIDN'T LIKE IT. Ok ok. Don't stone me all you matrix fans. I found the movie too long and too wordy at times. I am a great big fan of the first one but this movie tried too hard to impress and it failed. The action sequences are FAANTAASTIC, I must agree. BUT, they tend to be TOO long. For example, the scene on the moving truck. That was like half an hour long! Or the bit when Neo fought the many Agent Smiths. I don't even know why he bothered since they can't be killed anyway. One annoying thing I realised was that the dialogue and the action sequences did not blend nicely. It was like 30 mins of solid fighting, followed by 30 mins of dialogue only, then another 30 mins of action and lastly 30 mins of talking. I fell asleep during the architect scene. Ugh. New characters . I love Persephone! HOT mama in that ooh-so-tight dress. Her husband is such a cad and I didn't know eating cake can be such an orgasmic experience. Captain Nirobe played by Mrs Will Smith was another Hottie. Her boyfriend, the Commander, annoyed me and so did Agent Smith. Hugo Weaving shouldn't have renewed his contract for Matrix: Reloaded and just died in the first one. Actually Morpheus was also started to piss me off especially with all that babble about believing and prophecies and the "speech" in the cave. It reminded me of the speech Bill Pullman made in Independence Day and George Bush's speech during the war. Unnecessary drama. Oh! The end credits took 10 mins to roll!!!! The trailer for the third instalment had nothing to wow about which was a disappointment. Verdict I would pay $6.50 for the show. I did pay $6.50 for it. Despite my diatribe, I would definitely catch the third movie at the end of the year. Why? Because I've already watched the first two movies and I would like to have some form of closure. And frankly, I am eager to see how it ends.

I hate to sound trite, but if this girl won't go out with you because you're not tall enough or because you've never been in a relationship, and basically discounting you because of what you lack then perhaps there isn't much basis for a relationship in the first place. Why bother? What did you see in this girl that makes you think she's so right for you and you for her anyway? Anyway, the way I see it, you're being overly melodramatic and looking for "love" in the wrong places. Maybe you have some basis for grieving for something that was never really there in the first place, but I'm not seeing that right now.

im so dead juz toked to E's best fren again, who on my behalf, had tested E out..... lets juz quote verbatim wat e best fren told me: "of u.... she say fren lor... she dun c anythin more... den i askd if she can sense anythin la... she say no la... dun tink it's anythin more.... dowan b too sensitive n oso she dun tink shld haf anythin more." as if this wasnt bad enuf... "Ok she like tall guys... 1.7o or 1.75 tt kinda ht... n i keep saying she so short stil wan so tall for wat... haha Den she wants some1 who is more experienced... got r/ship b4 1... dowan a greenhorn... n now she has diz thing for manly pple rather than boyish...." to say its a major blow for my self-esteem is juz e least of it....... feeling a whole range of emotions rite now.... from bitterness, anger, frustration... to disappointment, sorrow, (self-loathing maybe?)... im not angry wif E... juz wif e cruelty of life n e arbitrariness of my God-given attributes... i've been given talents ppl wld be envious of for e rest of their lives, juz as much as i've not been given things dat i'd like to have but can neva attain.... e sorrow is of e fact dat i have to look at her from now on n see her as something dats literally so near, n yet so far... im not e type who can instantly turn ard n say dat ppl like E dun ever deserve me.... superfiicality n looks shldnt matter... blahblah... cos as much as it helps u feel better, its only a half-truth... for wks i have sincerely believed dat i do deserve her, n she does deserve me... i had neva wanted anything more... n yes, lets not kid ourselves dat looks dun matter, cos they do... i noe dat cos im juz like E, n juz like most ppl who can see... physical appearances does matter (in e short-run anyway)... ok, not dat im freaky-looking, but i muz admit i failed all e criteria she laid out there in 1 sentence... time will heal everything... dats true... juz hope dat e next time, something will werk out... meanwhile, i shall go back into my shell n wait it out... of cos, to have everything else in e world except luv, makes me wanna exchange everything for dat luv alone... Tis' the futile road to be travelled, by those blessed with many riches but cursed with lifelong loneliness...

Its a scam!! 2 days of job-hunting yielded zero results, a pair of spoiled shoes n a load of sweaty clothes from walking in torturous heat... how on earth do ppl get decent temp jobs anyway? certainly not thru classifieds, cos dats wat i did... n most of them ar juz charity projs selling 2-dollar coupons n letting u earn 20% of e funds u collect... promises of "various positions" available or $1200 per mnth ar empty... grrr... only thing dat din make my jobhunts a total disaster, was dat i went wif E.... heheh.... =p

Moving Out I moved out of my hostel room yesterday. Man, it was exhausting. Made a mistake of not getting boxes to pack my stuff in and I had to use all kinds of bags to store my things. I'm always amazed at the amount of junk I collect during the year. I made an effort not to buy knick knacks in my last year but I still have tons of things. I had a bag full of shoes, a bag full of bags and 3 bags full of clothes. Such a bimbo. Heh. One good thing about having a brother is that I can act as the damsel in distress so that he would carry all my things for me. Hahahah... Poor boy but it's good training for him. :p I spent the better part of my Sunday night cleaning out my room at home to make way for my things. Ugh. I collect alot of junk at home too. Oh gosh. My rubbish amounted to 2 huge black trash bags. Now everything is more or less in its place except for loose bits that are cluttering the floor. Once my room is in shape, I have to get my computer hooked up to the internet. May not be blogging so often these days cos my brother is glued to the main computer. Sheesh. So.. I'll be back.

We deserve it!!! =0) Cheers, honey!

i wish its so simple =/ hmm... unfortunately, those ladder analogies seem to oversimplify matters.... really, i do wish dat things were so simple... if its juz abt sex, i wldnt be in such a predicament now...... instead, here i am, trying to please someone like an eager puppy, in e hope dat something may come out of all this... were my actions all powered by testosterone, i wldnt bother wif all this trouble... heck, everyone noes it costs as little as 40 bucks at geylang if u arent dat fussy abt quality... for e classier ones, its really only a few hundred dollars a nite n u get probly e best lay of ur life, or at least for most guys, it wld be e best lay of our lives.... oops... erm... of cos all this is hearsay from my army frens who erm... yah, u get e idea ;p

Great food, great company Yesterday marked the end of my exams. My friends and I went to Cafe Vienna for high tea. How cool is that? Ate till we couldn't eat anymore. Loved the dim sum. We talked about school, people we know and had lots of laughter imitating certain characters. It was great fun. It had been a long time since the four of us got together to eat and chat. We took pictures and walked around Orchard Road to kill time. Orchard on a Friday was horrid. It was full of JC and secondary school kids. Ugh. There was a branded goods sale at Taka which Selin and I went to. I bought a new white top! Hee. Along the way, bumped into old, old friends and acquaintances, one whom I've not seen or spoken to since we were 12. Everyone looks so grown up now. Selin and I parted ways. I had to wait for bv and bv being bv was late. We went to Milieu bar and I had my first taste of acid jazz-house style music. There was a live performance by The Gordon Bennett Project . There was a couple who was doing the rock and roll to that type of music. It was beyond me as to how one can dance rock and roll to that. Jenny joined us halfway. Spotted a familiar face in the crowd. We saw the same Caucasian man at Zouk 2 weeks ago, leering at a girl who was dancing on the podium. He was there last night, lucky for us, not leering at anyone in particular. Crowd-watching can be really entertaining and I surprised myself by not feeling bored with the music. However it became house-y towards midnight, which none of us liked. Left for our usual place at HV, Breko. Check out the urlLink photos

Going to par-tay tonight, tomorrow night and every day until I get my results!

AMERICAN IDOL RECAP It's down to the last 2 men now. Just finished watching tonight's episode of AI2. Fantastic show since I like all the three contestants. Tonight, each of them performed 3 songs, a random choice, judges' choice and their own choice. Kimberley Locke Was the first singer tonight. Sang "Band of Gold", "Anyone Who Had a Heart" and "Inseparable". She did very well for the first song and the last one. I didn't quite like her second one. She has a lovely voice but sometimes she has trouble with certain songs. Tonight, however, was one of her better nights. Ruben Studdard He sang "Signed, Sealed, Delivered", "Smile" and "If Ever You're In My Arms Again". Ruben can hardly do any wrong. This younger version of Luther Vandross- Peabo Bryson can certainly deliver the goods. He surprised me with the ability to do an up-tempo song with "SSD". I loved his rendition of Peabo's "IEYIMAA". Clay Aiken Clay was the last singer in each set. He sang "Vincent", "Mack the Knife" and "Unchained Melody". I've said it before and I'll say it again, he really has the voice. However, he does tend to have the annoying habit of over-enunciating and over-singing a song. He had the worst performance with his rendition of "Vincent", a slow song which he forgot the lyrics to the song halfway. "MTK" was very well done but I liked the jazz version better and "UM" was well done only towards the end. Results Without further ado, Kimberley was knocked out of the competition. Blah Blah Blah, we can now look forward to next week's show.

Comment Someone 's got a bee up her butt eh? heh. Guys aren't that bad, you know. Granted, yeah, most of them can be such bastards, but I believe a totally platonic relationship is really possible. More Clarifications Just to let everyone know, this site has no censorship of any form. I'm the last person to impose a non-vulgarity rule on this site, since my mouth can be as filthy as the next sailor that comes in to town. So, Cale, you don't have to worry about me disapproving any of your materials. That won't happen. *grin* No need to ask for permission, all contributors can write whatever they wish to. However, I do draw a line at insensitive comments touching on politics , heh, don't want the gah-men (that's government for non-Singlish speaking people) rating my site as a political site and religion (don't want to incite any race/religious riots). But other than that, anything goes. As for including new contributors, so far, those on the list are my friends. Anyone who wishes to contribute to my site may email me so I can get to know you a bit better. But I've not added anyone new and I can get quite anal about who I invite. This is cos, well, no reason. This is my site, and I can do whatever I want. So there. Don't be afraid. I don't bite. *grin* Well, just teeny weeny bit and only if you piss me off.

What he REALLY means when he says.... - The Spy Eye in a Guy's Lie(s) Once again, the cynical sardonic bitch is out here ranting...James Hall is a freakin' bad lover whose material has failed to keep my attention even for 5 minutes...thus you find me here feeling frustrated, undernourished (in every way) and demented with hate that almost everyone I know is ending their exams tomorrow...screw it. I can't even lament at the world for being unfair (because it IS unfair and thus I'm a natural victim *duh). So, which it has brought me to thinking - what do men really mean when they say something?? Oh, this is something that even the Gray guy who wote the Mars/Venus series can't even teach you... When he says.... 1) We've grown apart -Yeah, what he really means is that you were a size 6 and now you're up there in the 24's. So, lose it, fat ass. 2) I just need to find myself - Yeah, what he really means is that he needs to find himself with someone else..so, scoot and beat it, lady. 3) We just don't seem to have anything in common!! - Right, that secretary don't swing both ways and there's only enough there for me. 4) No, we're just friends - Yeahright...so, what did they teach you in kindergarten? Share (me) with your friends... 5) This relationship is getting too serious - What he really means is you're cutting into the time I wanna spend with checking out the others... 6) What did I do this time? - What he really means is "What did you catch me doing?" 7) Do you want to go to a movie/dinner? - He means "I'd eventually like to have sex with you" 8) I love you. Will you marry me? - What he really means is "*Phew! There! I've said it. We'd better have sex now and I also want to make it illegal for you to have sex with other guys... Do they take us for their fools??? Publisher's Note - Guys! This is a rant. However, hahahahaha, comments, jibe-backs, opposition claims, denials, curses and any other form of verbal abuse is welcome....*snickers - don't hate me: shit happens.

Wise Words for a Jilted Lover from a Cycnical Sardonic Bitch Sweet Revenge - what does one do after a heartbreak or self-induced heartache?? Or per say, what are the things that are available for one to do in such low, crummy situation?? As for me, the emotional junkie high on the drug "hurt me one more time, baby!!!", the immediate reaction is listening to weepy sad songs that sing of hope and of love lost and found. The secondary reaction is, well of course, bugging the shit outta the bastard, and then drawing up plans for REVENGE 101...Screw the songs. WTF do they know what they're talkin' about? Do you realize that the lyrics always seem to respond in your interpretations DEPENDING on your mood? I can never figure out why... Of sending Black roses, Grim Reaper roses and Whoreweed bouquets: I prefer insults. Yes. Insults. Sarcasm cuts the other and heals me. It's a balance, as usual....le monde is always in its conservation of energy, moods, happiness/sadness, momentum, etc etc Some Shakespearian-inspired insults for the intellectuals - please use sparingly and speak distinctly...the unchallenged one may misunderstand and the effect dost lost. 1) This woman's an easy glove, my lord, she goes off and on at pleasure (from All's Well that End's Well) 2) I desire that we be better strangers (from As You Like It) 3) What shall I call thee when thou art a man ? (from As You Like It) 4) Think'st thou, though her father be very rich, any man is so very a fool to be married to hell? (From the Taming of the Shrew) 5) There's small choice in rotten apples (from the Taming of the Shrew) 6) Out of my sight, thou dost infect mine eyes (from Richard III) 7) What a disgrace it is to me that I should remember your name (from Henry IV) 8) You have as little honesty as honour (from Henry VIII) So, who said Literature was boring??? Apart from fantasies (hahaha, Nephthys), there's much to glean and utilize...

Clarification First, I'm not a perv! Honest! To be fair to me and my tutor, it wasn't a make out, make out. It was more of a kiss. There was no tongue, no groping, no nothing! It was just one of those freakish dreams. Do you get that? (hint to Morgan) And the shitting thing, now that's just gross.

i don't sleep, i dream i don't know, i guess so i don't sleep, i dream i'll settle for a cup of coffee, but you know what i really need r.e.m. no matter how far mankind ever progresses, we'll never ever understand the idea behind dreams. yeah yeah its our subconscious kicking into play (which very much explains nefi's lit tutor dreams) but how? and why? i found out that if you actually wake up earlier and then sleep again for another hour or so before really getting up, you'd really remember your dreams (particularly useful for me since i usually forget them all). also helps a lot if you're like me when you go about your normal mundane life and something just strikes you but you don't know what.. something so familiar, yet distant.. and then you struggle to figure if whatever just flashed across your mind really happened before or if it was just a dream. its scary. yeah and remembering your dreams is so much fun. i still remember my dream of shitting non stop for goodness knows how long. i mean, i just kept shitting and shitting like there was no tomorrow. or like it was going out of fashion the next day. or like my life depended on it. well, guess that reveals quite a bit about what goes on in my subconscious, but i'm glad it's just me and not my lit tutor.
*jaw drops* i have absolutely no idea how to respond to e previous 2 postings...

The Erotic Dream - Of Snakes and Vampires Damn it..can someone here teach me how to put images in??? Anyways, time to get inside the vault of my dreams...I classify good dreams and nightmares as one as the same..why??
