Now we noe y nanyang gals ar weird went to nanyang gals high today for interview for a relief teaching position... heck, its only a relief teaching position mind u, but they had an interview panel so illustrious only e board of governors were absent... e principal, vp, hod gep, hod english, i lost count after shaking 4 hands n cldnt remember whos in wat office... anyway... i came across as an idiot wif no experience of teaching watsoever... of cos dats true to a large extent, but the best thing was i even ended up arguing wif the hod gep abt how to teach descriptive writing to students... she asked me how, i said dat for e 1st essay i may juz let them explore e genre on their own n not tell them too much abt structure n all... but she condescendingly smiled n said there was no time for dat n asked if i was serious... hell, wif her attitude, n if this was a classroom discussion, i'd show her how serious i was... n she had to be e only one grilling me wif all e tough questions while e rest of them kept quiet... sheesh... i've been thru some interviews n this had to be my worst thus far... if e VP werent such a nice lady by escorting me in n out of e sch, i'd have had another grudge wif yet another gals sch (erm... had a few feuds wif rgs b4, but dats another story) now we noe y nanyang gals ar weird... wif such oppressive teachers n a restrictive system, no wunder they called me to go for an interview... cos no one else was interested... from wat i saw in e staffroom, e teachers were 95% females as well... poor deprived students.... yah so anyway, i seriously doubt if i'd land e job... of cos e usual courtesy was to ask me when i was avaialble n dat they wld contact me later... e day continued in e same vein... finally called E only to find dat shes on e line n cant tok... n when she smsed me to say shes free to tok an hr later, i wasnt in e mood anymore... heh... call me an idiot again, but dats e way i am... =p

I went shopping today, first time in a looong time. Boy, it felt good! My day started off late due to my late night. Met bv, his cuz and bro at Toys R Us to look for toys! Wow. Kids nowadays are spoilt for choice when it comes to toys. The selection of toys at Toys R Us are immense. It was fun looking at the barbie collection (I love the collectibles), the huge stuffed bears and all sorts of play things. If I had a kid, I would definitely buy tons of toys for him/her. After that we went to Puncak to eat. Puncak is this very delicious food stall located at the 5th floor of Far East. Bv's cuz and bro were going to watch X-Men 2 after that while bv and I went to check out the new Zara shop at Liat Towers (I think). Was abit disappointed in the selection of clothes on display but definitely ogled at the shoes. We were looking for Mother's Day gifts for our respective moms. Checked out stores at Wisma and Taka but we couldn't find anything we liked there. Had coffee at Key Coffee, Taka. I tried the expresso for the very first time. Needed the caffeine shot cos my tongue was dead, ie, I was too sleepy to talk. Expresso was awfully strong but it was good. Wouldn't try it again though cos I couldn't make the thing last for more than 15 mins. We went to The Heeren after that. I was looking for a gift for one of my tuition kids. Headed towards the Met shop at Centrepoint cos bv wanted to show me earrings he was considering buying for his mom. It was lovely. SOMEONE HELP ME Oh dear god. I think I'm hooked on to blog and this whole blogging business. The only way I could make myself stop blogging for a couple of hours was to lug all my books and study at a friend's room. Even then, I had to take a break every few hours and make my way back to my room and blog. I find this whole aspect of blogging; the html coding, looking for stuff to post, looking for stuff to add onto my templates etc, exciting and interesting. Holy crap, I'm such a geek. *shudder* Although I don't post often, haha, face it, I doubt anyone would want to read about the happenings of my day, I love to tweak my site. I like looking at the html lines and thinking of ways to improve it. Then I would read other people's sites and find things to add onto my site. Hence I've added a new tag board, a calendar, erm, recategorized my links and many other things that aren't probably noticeable at all. I realise that this sudden interest to blog might also be due to the fact that I'm in the midst of my exams. Bleah. The dreaded finals. It is my style to find something new to do every time an exam comes along. So for the past 2 semesters, I found the joy in blogging. Previously, I was dancing throughout my exams and when I was younger, I loved to colour. Haha.. A little bit of trivia about me. :) Aside from blogging, I end up reading other people's blogsites as well. Fascinating insights into their lives. *grin* They live halfway around the world and it is interesting to read about the things that they write about. Some of their sites have been added onto my favourite blog links. I stopped working on my angelfire website (sorry to those who have visited it only to find that there are no new updates) mainly because it got too tedious and also, I want to get my hands on the dreamweaver programme. I don't have the software with me and I've made that my holiday project. Speaking of holidays, I would be totally free come next Friday! yay for me but it also means that I've gotta get a job; a permanent job, since I'll be graduating this semester (fingers crossed) and that nothing goes wrong with my papers (knock on wood). Ok. Seeing as I have a paper tomorrow morning, Accounting Theory (YUCK! EUGH!) I oughta get my mind back on track.

MOVIE REVIEW - X MEN 2 Yay! It's movie review time! I actually did it last night but stupid blogger screwed up and didn't load my page. I watched X-Men 2 last night, shush, all you muggers. I know I have a paper on Wed but my conscience ran away so I made use of the free time to catch a movie. I LOVE X-Men.. the movie as well as the cartoon... hee.. ok ok.. the men as well. *grin* The Plot The plot isn't as riveting as the first one, which was quite a shame. There was plot development in terms of the war between humans and mutants. This time round, our X-men had to team up with bad mutants Magneto and Co to fight the common enemy, William Stryker. I was unhappy with the romantic subplots that were included in this sequel. Budding romance between Rogue (Anna Paquin) and Iceman (Shawn Ashmore) as well as the never-ending love triangle between Jean (Famke Janssen), Wolverine (Hugh Jackman!) and Cyclops (James Marsden). The puppy romance thing between our two adolscent mutants was quite funny cos these two horny teenagers can't do much as Rogue will just suck the life out of her beau if they kissed, which they did, and she almost killed him. Unfortunately the dialogue had bad one liners, corny at best and cringe-worthy at worst. [oh crap, blogger seems to think that my review is too long. So i'm posting the reviews over 3 posts]

[Part II] The Mutants There are new mutants to spice up the movie, with the death (I'm assuming) of Toad and Sabretooth in the last movie. As always, the mutants are the biggest draw of the show. Who's going to watch X-men for a heavy drama full of irony and pathos? Not me, that's for sure. New mutants are: a) Lady Deathstrike played by Kelly Hu. Such a hottie! Those claws, the glassy eyes. She doesn't speak much, hmm, I think she only had 1 line. But this kitten made an impression. Would love to see her hook up with Wolverine. b) Nightcrawler played by Alan Cumming. Blue skinned ala Mystique, with a tail ala the Devil and fangs ala Dracula. This mutant is funny cos he had one of the best one-liners and the German accent was amusing. This mutant is a staunch Catholic as well. c) Pyro played by Aaron Stanford. Ahh, an adolescent mutant. CUTE to boot! Friend of Rogue and Iceman. The bad boy of the group. He ran away with Magneto at the end of the movie, so we know that he's going to be one of the bad guys in the next instalments of X-men. d) Iceman played by Shawn Ashmore. Rogue's boyfriend. Fingertips can freeze things. Pretty cool. Cute in a nerd-ish way. Not as cute as Pyro though. haha. If I were 15 again, I would totally dig these 2 boys. The older mutants are still around. Jean, Storm and Mystique featured more prominently this time round. Mystique had the coolest scene where she slid out of the door backwards and her middle finger shown. Haha. That was funny. This lady has class, finesse and attitude. She also has the coolest power. Oh. And she may have a thing for Wolverine.

[Part III] The Effects Bryan Singer didn't disappoint. The effects are great, especially when it comes to showing off the mutant powers. On the whole, I'd pay about $7 to $7.50 to watch the show. :) The mutants played a big part in the ratings.

I had a tiff with my computer last night. Stupid thing threw a fit when I was trying to scan it for viruses. Let me tell you the story. While was transfering files to a hall friend last night, she informed me that I was sending her viruses as well. I decided to scan my pc to detect the infected files. I already had a hunch that the game software I downloaded from Kazaa was infected. So anyway, the scan was soooo slow at one point that I decided to cancel the scan and just delete the files that I thought were infected. But noooo.... computer threw a fit. It hung on me when I opened the folder. I had to restart my pc and each time I accessed that particular folder, it hung. I had to restart my pc about 5 times! My computer is such a bitch. It refused to budge despite all my cajoling and my threats. It totally ignored me and continued to hang. I was so pissed that I restarted the thing, turned on the scan and left the room. That will teach it not to mess with me in future. I will not tolerate such mutiny from a mere machine. A stupid machine. Went back this morning to check on it. Found 3 infected files which couldn't be repaired. The quarantine thing hung on me. Damn. The stupid folder still refused to work. I restarted the scan and left the room again. I will only check on it later in the evening. UGH. Damned machine.

YOOHOO! Woah... blogger changed its template during my 5-day trip to Thailand. Thailand was great! Saw lots of temples, Buddhas and more Buddhas; Emerald Buddha, reclining Buddha and even a 40-foot Buddha. The night life was happening. Made guest appearances at the Ministry of Sound, a Transsexual Cabaret, a sex show and Hard Rock Cafe. MOS was ok, played lots of morgan's kind of music, ie, not my kind of music. Calypso, the Cabaret (hey! alliteration!) was fantastic. Very much like Boom Boom, with better costumes, but the "girls" had less spunk compared to Kumar's "girls". The sex show, aka, Firecat, was the least sleazy, as mentioned in the Lonely Planet guidebook. It was more of a circus act rather than an erotic show. Saw lots of breasts and vaginas, but trust me, they aren't a turn-on. The girls couldn't dance, and for 300 baht ($12) I only saw vagina acrobats like blowing a trumpet using the vagina, pushing and squeezing out ping pong balls and pulling strings out of the vaginas. UGH. GROSS. Food was utterly divine, crepes, tom yam and hotel buffet! Shopped quite a bit, although the weather and squeezy Chatuchak market drove me insane, made me really crabby that day. Great fun travelling with bv again. Jenny was cool as well. Photos are mostly with bv since he brought his laptop so, i dumped all my photos into it. I brought speakers so that we could listen to our shit in the room. So, photos would be up whenever i receive them.

Movie Review - The Little Chinese Seamstress hmm... this isnt exactly ur usual movie review, since i didnt actually watch e film in a cinema, but on cable juz last nite... if u dun already noe, channel 56 does show some foreign films occasionally, n i was channel surfing in b/w wimbledon's commercial breaks when i caught a glimpse of e film 15 mins into its screening time... i neva touched e remote again... dats how entranced i was... Synopsis: during e peak of e cultural revolution in 1971 china, 2 uptown city youths were sent to a remote village in e 3 gorges region to recieve "re-education", where they were supposed to immerse themselves in e culture of peasantry n menial labor, while purging themselves of e practices of their intellectualist parents (labeled as enemies of e ppl). There, they meet a gal, e grand-daughter of an aged tailor (who, i gotta admit, is darn cute wif her elfin face), n of cos, both guys fall in luv wif her... Intrigued by her beauty, as much as her ignorance n innocence, both start to court her by reading to her from a secret stash of illegal foreign novels... Seducing her with tales from Tolstoy, Dostoevsky (however u spell his name), and Balzac, the three discover all the desires that had, until then, been suppressed, changing thier perspectives of life, as well as their lives, forever... Gripes: hmm.... i really cant tink of anything to complain abt... tho there were a few inconsistencies within e film, when 1 of e male leads inexplicably spoke in a standard mandarin accent, when he was speaking in a sichuan accent thruout e rest of e movie... e musical score cld have been better as well, but hey, u cant have everything in a low budget french movie... oh yes, din i mention it? director Dai Sijie is a chinese based in france... so all dialogue is in mandarin but end credits ar in french... Compliments: okie... i muz say this again... zhou xun, e female lead playing e role of e little seamstress, is darn cute!!! okok... *tries hard to calm down* i wld put a screenshot of her here, but i dunno how to! *wails* Besides this, e film is filled wif pans of an exhilirating backdrop of e 3 gorges region... villages perched on cliff edges dat fall away into e rushing river 1000 ft below.... its actually based on e director's semi-autobiography "balzac and the little chinese seamstress", n e plot is extremely poignant... e innocence (i prefer it to ignorance or stupidity) of e villagers influenced by maoism, is almost palpable n compels u to feel for them, as they listen enthralled to e 2 boys' made-up stories of communist propaganda films they purportedly saw.... this isnt a movie dat provokes alternative thought, but one dat seeks to move e audience into sharing e regret, angst n beliefs of e characters... from wat i saw, it has succeeded in doing so... All in all: u gotta watch it to noe wat im toking abt!! only way u can do so is probly by d/ling on kazaa or soemthing... unless u wait for e reruns on cable (which is God noes when) if u liked The Road Home (starring Zhang Ziyi n directed by Zhang Yimou), u'll probly like this even more... i'd pay 10 bucks to watch it in e theatre, much less 8.50 =p

BOOK REVIEW - HARRY POTTER & THE ORDER OF THE PHOENIX I pre-ordered my book on urlLink Acmabooks so that I didn't have to wake up early and queue for it. In the end, I woke up at 6.30 and reached Suntec by 8.30. I have finished reading the book and this is my opinion of it. Being a HUGE fan of Harry Potter (although I started reading the book only last year, but I read each book at least 4 times), I had high expectations for Book 5. However, the first read has disappointed me. Now, don't lynch me, all you HP fans (hint to Siti, especially if you liked it. *grin*). No doubt the book is alot thicker than Goblet of Fire, but sadly, it is not half as interesting. I felt that JK Rowling has sold out to commercialism. It's like a big budget movie with no soul. The plot was not as riveting as any of the first four books and the whole fighting thing at the Ministry of Magic lacked depth and suspense. Even the death of the key character (you're not getting any spoilers from me) was not as emotional or tragic as Cedric's death and he wasn't even a key character. Pace & Plot The pacing of the book is SLOW. Harry only started school about halfway through the book. In terms of content, nothing major developed till page 400 or so. Alot of waiting involved, waiting for Lord Voldemort to make his move, waiting for Harry to start school, waiting for Harry to meet his friends, waiting for his friends, waiting for other people, waiting for time.. waiting.. waiting.. waiting.... Get my drift? Rowling devoted attention to all her characters, there's no doubt about that; Fred and George, Cho, Malfoy and other schoolmates all had book time. But it felt like she was trying to develop too many characters simultaneously, and thus, affecting the quality of each character. She also brought in the politics of the Ministry into the book, which, I'm sure is essential to the whole Lord Voldemort thing, but it takes away the magical feeling of Hogwarts, it is now a war. [end of part 1]

[Part 2] Characters Harry seems to be suffering from a case of teenage angst. A very angry boy and it's a headache to read his dialogue in CAPS. Imagine him screaming most of the time. "BOO HOO! NOBODY LOVES ME EVERYBODY HATES ME!" Ugh. Exhausting. The relationship between Harry and Snape hasn't improved. If anything, it actually got worst. Harry hates Snape now. He also hates Dudley. Like I said, such an angry boy. There is a new character, a certain Delores Umbridge. Oh my god. I absolutely hate her, which is a good thing, cos it means that Rowling did a good job of characterising her. She is awful! Her appearance, the way she speaks, her condescending tone. I was actually glad she got (Ok, spoiler coming up) captured by the centaurs. Overall I didn't like it. As I've said, I felt that Rowling has sold out or at least suffered a major block. I sincerely hope that book 6 and 7 will be better. To be fair to Harry Potter, I shall read it one more time and see if my opinion of it changes. Who knows, it may actually get better with time.
Congrats azri and all graduates! I'm in Brisbane and I have HP book 5. Life is good.

The Hulk review hmm... watched e pre-world premiere of The Hulk on tues nite... was some OCBC family outing thing, n e theatre was full of middle aged folks wif their pri sch kids... got a free hulk notepad, poster n erm... green pop corn Gripes: boy, was i surprised by e length of e whole movie... it was freakin 2hrs n 15 mins long!!! for an action movie wif no drama, it sure was hell going thru e 1st 1 hr where too much time was spent explaining wats wrong wif bruce banner, wif weird visuals of cells being invaded by "nanomeds" n bombarded by green gamma rays... if u tot Days of Our Lives is draggy, wait till u watch The Hulk. of cos being adapted into a movie, e story doesnt really follow e comic strip, n some parts abt bruce banner's father were too inexplicable even by my acme cartoon standards. e epic battle b/w e hulk n his dad was well... so full of bright lite n scientific mumbo jumbo, i had no idea wat was going on. e Hulk's comic strip personality n utter invincibility was also not portrayed in e movie. believe u me, hes not as likeable in e comic as he is in e show. Grudging compliments: to be fair, eric bana n jennifer connelly were alrite... nick nolte was, as usual, relishing in his quirky role as bruce banner's deranged-scientist-dad... best actor shld go to Hulk (or as he was codenamed by e US military in e show - angryman), wif his powerful performances n comical leaps along mountain ridges n desert plains (even tho he may be a computer generated freak). e visual effects were not exactly stunning but wat u'd expect from movies nowadays, n action sequences had funny elements in them too... its ang lee directing so action sequences had to be gd. Overall: if u can, skip e 1st hr of e show n go direct to e last hr... n erm, i dun see how anyone can pay 8.50 for this unless u were manhandled into e theatre. i watched it for free =p

When you step into a shower, which part of the body do you wash first? Please select a body part A. Chest B. Face C. Armpits D. Hair E. Privates F. Shoulders G. Others A. Chest: You are a practical person. Straightforward and do not beat around the bush. To you, convenience is of paramount importance. You hate to be distracted when concentrating and are impatient with people who do not see things your way. A good sex partner and willing to try new things. Your best partner in life will be those who choose D (Hair). B. Face: Money is important to you and you will do anything to get it. Integrity and dignity is not important. You feel that friends are there to be used and life is one big hassle. Other people find it hard to understand you, but you are not concerned as to what they think. Very self-centered person. Average sex partner as too selfish and tend to be absorbed in self pleasure at the expense of your partner. Your best partner in life will be those who choose E (Privates) and G (Others). C. Armpits: You are a dependable and hard working person. Generally very popular person as you are very down to earth and willing to help others. Tend to get yourself into trouble as you cannot tell whether people are genuine towards you. Make very poor sex partners as you are the working type with average talent. Your best partner in life will be those who choose F (Shoulders). D. Hair: Artistic type. Daydreaming is your hobby, but you can achieve what most other people cannot. Dedication is lacking, but you will work tirelessly towards goals which are to your liking. Money is not important. Friends are but only intellectuals and fellow artistic types. Make the best sex partners as you are most willing to explore and please ther other partner. Talent is your main strength. Your best partner in life will be those who chose A (Chest) and E (Privates). E. Privates: Shy type. You lack self confidence and tend to be bullied by others. Your best sex partner in life will be those who choose B (Face) and D (Hair). F. Shoulder: A born loser. You fail in everything that you do. People dislike you and you tend to spend your time alone. Your type have been known to be heavy gamblers and drinkers. You see the world as a livin hell. Money and power is also important to you. But your luck will always fail you. Deep down, you are very likeable person with very few faults. However, the key will be to make your strengts stand out and not just hide you weaknessess. You are an average sex partner. You have great fantasies about different techniques, but unfortunately are not brave enough to try them out. Your best partner in life will be those who choose B (Face).

HAPPY FATHERS' DAY everyone!! Any grand plans for today? I didn't buy my dad a present. Heh, it's so difficult to find my dad a present for his birthday or for Fathers' Day that I don't. The last gift I remember giving him was a thong. Haha, yeah, it came in a nutshell. One of those things from House of Humour. Thank god my dad has a sense of humour. *grin* But he did say the thong was too small. So gross. This year, I'm going to bake him a cake. More specifically, a chocolate mocha cake. Ooh, I hope it turns out right. My baking afternoon at Selin's house last Thursday didn't go so well cos we bought the wrong type of chocolate and the fudge was BITTER! Ugh. I couldn't even swallow the cake. heh. Oh man. I've been waking up earlier and earlier every day now. That's just fucking ridiculous. I'm supposed to enjoy my vacation. Sleep in, wake up late, laze around on the bed. But NOOO... I woke up at 7.45 this morning! And it's a Sunday!! I woke up at 8.30 yesterday despite sleeping only at 4.30am. Bugger. Ooh! urlLink Harry Potter will be out next Sat! And so will my exam results!! AARGH! I'm soooooooo worried. Alot of what-ifs going on in my mind and all of them aren't pleasant what-ifs. Should I buy the Harry Potter book? But I didn't buy the first 4 books. I hate collecting books halfway through the series. And what if it's the cartoony edition? If I buy it, the first 4 books have to be like that, to ensure continuity. But I don't like the cartoony version. So, what if I buy the cartoony one, then get the nicer, meaning the Scholastic, version for the first 4 books then wait for the nicer version of Book 5 to come out and buy that. Ugh. That would mean that I have 2 versions of book 5, wouldn't it? Heh, ok ok. Too much musing over a book. Plans for today. Hmm.. bake my cake. And possibly watch a play later at night. Haven't exactly decided yet. Bv wants me to watch it cos it is value for money. I was too lazy to watch it with him and Jenny last night. He said it sucked so bad that people left halfway. However, it was a good experience, to see how badly a play can suck. And I'm always a sucker (pardon the pun) for bad shows. Morgan should know. Always a never-ending dispute between us as to who suggested the movie " urlLink Slap her She's French ". I still maintain that it was him.

MOVIE REVIEW - THE PIANIST Finally watched the show! It was screened again at Alliance Francais this entire week. It was a very good film. There were some particularly disturbing scenes, especially when the Nazis threw the wheelchair guy out of the window and shot the rest of his family as they were running. Oh, the horror! Adrien Brody did a great job of portraying Szpilman and he had the tortured face portrayed perfectly. Although it was a long movie, it moved along nicely, unlike the Matrix where everything just plodded on. Characters Heh, I can't quite remember their names, much less spell them. But none of the characters annoyed me. I particularly liked the German who saved Szpilman's life. Verdict Would definitely pay $8.50 to watch it.

BUFFY THE VAMPIRE SLAYER I have finished reading the transcripts of Buffy (BTVS). My verdict: I love it. It's a biased judgement because I was more interested in just two characters, Spike (James Marsters) and urlLink Buffy (Sarah Michelle Gellar). When I first read the transcripts last year, I was shocked with the whole Spike-loves-Buffy-let's-have-sex shit. Although the transcripts sounded like a bad trashy novel, I did enjoy reading it. Plus, urlLink Spike is just so hot! The attitude, the (fake, James is from California) accent. He can BITE me if he wants to. After a slow start with Season 6, the remaining episodes seems more engaging and I would definitely make a point to watch it every Wednesday. urlLink Tara breaks up with urlLink Willow , Tara dies, Willow goes all bad. All very exciting! Buffy and Spike have alot of violent sex. (I wonder how much of it would be censored). urlLink Xander left urlLink Anya at the alter, Anya becomes a vengeance demon again. Buffy and Spike have alot of violent sex (Yes, I repeated it again for emphasis). Buffy "breaks" up with Spike. urlLink Dawn is less irritating. The season ends with Spike in Africa getting his soul back. Ooh, Ang urlLink el is gonna make an appearance in Season 7. Willow finds a new lover. I doubt any of the sex or kissing scenes would be shown here. Buffy saves the day, but Spike died(?), correct me if I'm wrong, but that's what I assumed.

Movie Review - PHONE BOOTH Aargh. Whatever you do, don't ever watch this show UNLESS you have the urge to throw $6.50 away. In that case, the money would be put to better use if you gave it to me. I fell asleep in the first 10 minutes of the show. Why? Cos the seat at Cineleisure was so comfy and in my defense, I always get sleepy after lunch. Phone booth was shot in a phone booth. Really. A lame-o plot about a sniper who was targeting Colin Farrel's character, Stu, who always called his girlfriend using that particular phone booth every day. Why use a phone booth when you have a cell phone, one might ask? Weeell, cos Stu here also had a wife, so a certain amount of discretion was necessary. Anyway, sniper-man decided to play god and demanded that Stu owned up to his wife about his little affair.. yadda yadda yadda [skip to the end] The ending was stupid as well. The police shot a guy, whom they thought was sniper man, a twist was needed. Sniper man was still alive but Stu was too drugged up to notify anyone. Characters Hunk schmunk. Colin Farrel, in my opinion, is not as hot as everybody thinks. He annoys me, in the show as well as in person. The funniest parts of the movie involved 3 hookers who saw their pimp getting shot by the sniper but they thought it was Stu who shot him. Heh. They were coarse and cute. Ooh, the guy who acted in Judging Amy as Judge Gray's male clerk or paralegal, Bruce, had a role as one of the police officers in the show. Now, that's a hunk. Rating Erm, would only watch if someone paid for me.

Update Ooh, have not blogged for about 4 days. I conducted a workshop for a Primary 5 class on Mon and Tues. I was so nervous cos it was my first time teaching and talking to a bunch of kids. But it turned out alright. I must say, I actually enjoyed myself. I think I prefer children to be chatty and lively as opposed to quiet and well-behaved. Although chatty children turn the class up-side down, they are definitely more interesting. I realised that I also prefer small children, not those big boys that always look sweaty. *grin* Grosses me out.

REVIEW Title: The Vagina Monologues Venue: The Substation Review time! The Vagina Monologues or as bv put it crudely, Cunt Talk is just a series of monologues about the vagina performed by 3 Filipino women (it was a Filipino production). And boy, the vagina was the topic of the night. A highly entertaining production, the monologues paid tribute to various women, a Serbian woman who was raped, an old lady who did not want to talk about her vagina and a Southern woman who thought of her vagina as furniture. Some questions were raised during the monologues: If your vagina could wear clothes, what would it wear? If your vagina could speak, what would it say? Some of the answers included, "diamonds only" and "Go slow". *grin* One delightful monologue was about a woman who wanted to reclaim the word "cunt". C-U-N-T. One has to be there to hear her say it. Extremely entertaining. Another monologue spoke of a woman who loved to make other women happy. The performer who did the monologue gave very vivid descriptions of the various forms of moan, culminating in the triple-orgasm-something-or-other moan. I thoroughly enjoyed myself last night.

Shopping Mania I went a little nuts yesterday as I was out with bv looking for a present for cor. After lunch at the delicious Puncak (I love the shredded chicken noodle!) place at Far East, I made a mistake of walking into Chaos , this little shop that sells clothes that I've always wanted to buy but couldn't afford. Anyway, everything in that shop was going for $9! Yes! Nine bucks only! I went in and grabbed 2 tops and 2 skirts. One of the tops is a lacy, toga top which I'm still figuring out how to wear without showing an iota of skin around my belly. The other top is a 3/4 sleeved velvet top. I couldn't try any of those tops on. Bleah. I never understood why shops insist of imposing such stupid rules. Why the fuck would you prevent a paying customer from trying on clothes that are on sale? Sheesh. The 2 skirts that I bought are knee-length, one brown and one silvery. I had to take a leap of faith and hoped that at least 2 of the items could fit me well. There was another rack where tops were going at $9 for 2. But I liked only 1. The lady didn't let me buy just one. How dumb can that be? In the end, I had to find another piece that I liked. So from that rack, I bought 2 tube-ish tops that I can wear under my over-sized blouses or any transluscent clothes that I may purchase in future. Total cost:$45 Total time taken to shop: under 30 mins I went back to try on my purchases. I'm glad to say that I can fit into all of them although the brown skirt is a little too figure-hugging for my liking. The 3/4 sleeved one is a little too big and I guess I could wear it as a maternity top. Heh. If I decide to get have kids in future. I love my toga top. But there is no way I'm ever going out wearing that top without using at least a shawl or a cardigan to cover myself. Oh dear. Impulse buys aren't always good. I always make this mistake of buying things that I never wear. Maybe I can have an online auction thing.

If only everyday could be like this....

Music Review The Cardigans - Long Gone Before Daylight Drums: Bengt Lagerberg, Bass: Magnus Sveningsson, Keyboard: Lars-Olof Johansson, Guitar: Peter Svensson, Vocals: Nina Persson whew... those names took me 5 mins juz to type... For lovers of slow rock, wif funky keyboards n purposeful lyrics, this is THE album to get! Nina Persson, solo chanteuse, not only performs e vocals, but also pens e beautiful lyrics for all 11 songs abt awkward relationships (aptly titled Communication), reasons to love (You're the Storm, And Then You Kissed Me) n love fading over time (Could'nt Care Less). The not too extraodinary voice of Persson, further lends an earthly quality to e songs, allowing listeners to readily identify wif e issues addressed. Personal favs of mine in e album include Please Sister n A Good Horse, while simple but poignant words in Communication truly strikes chords within my heart... I've seen u, i know u, but i dont know how to connect, so i disconnect Lead Me Into The Night is yet another which impresses... Was reading through urlLink Cale's blog and I realised that I have not done much bitching on my site lately. After much musing, I came to the conclusion that it was not because of a lack of things to rant about, I was just too lazy to write my thoughts down. I miss all that bitching and ranting. Jumping on the bitchwagon, I have a few things to get off my [ urlLink unHooters-like ] chest. Not many people know of my dislike for urlLink Gurmit Singh . Yes, I really, really dislike him. "Singapore's very own Jim Carrey" my ass. It started with his portrayal of that horrid character, Phua Chu Kang and spiralled downwards when he sang that Sar-Vivor Rap shite. Whoever composed that rap ought to be shot. But it seems that the audiences (or at least, the TV execs) love Gurmit, cos now he has his own TV show, a kids show a la Bill Crosby's Kids Say the Darnest Things. Unfortunately, it fails to amuse me. When having a kids show, it is important to realise that the stars of the show should be the children and NOT the host. It also doesn't help the show if the host tries to be in the limelight by acting like a kid (and overdoing it of course). Gurmit also thinks he is so funny, but really, he is not THAT funny. Funny in a slapstick, bang head against wall, way, yes, but funny in a witty way, NO. I guess hosting a kids show is good for him because only children will be amused by his schtick, Next rant : urlLink Prudential and any other insurance roadshows. I mention Prudential specifically because I was ambushed twice by them at two different MRT stations. Their sales pitch is always the same. Prudential (P) : Do you save? Me (M) : No P : If you do, how much would you save? M : But I don't. P : But if you do, how much? 100? 200? M : Fine fine. (sigh) Between 100 - 200. P : Where do you put your savings? M : In a bank. P : Do you know that if you put 100 a month in a bank, after 25 years you'll only get $30,000? [do the Math yourself] M : Oh really? [Like i give a fuck] P : Yes. But if you put your money in a Prudential savings plan, you'll get $48,000 after 25 years. M : Oh really? [I still don't care] P : So, can you tell me which one you would prefer? M : Obviously consumers are going to tell you that they would prefer a plan which gives more returns. But like I told the first Prudential guy, I'm not working and I would rather have the cash then to put it all in a savings plan. P : What if I told you that at the end of the year, you can withdraw $750 from your account, no questions asked? M : So? I need the cash now and not at the end of the year. P : Will it be ok if I called you every 2 weeks just to keep you updated? M : There's no point. I'm not going to get a job in 2 weeks. And it better not be a recruitment call cos I'm telling you now, I'm not interested. Ugh. If another guy comes up to me trying to sell some plan, I'll ask him to go jump off a cliff (or fuck himself, whichever). Irritating buggers. I'm betting that it will turn out to be a recruitment call cos that's what happened with the first Prudential guy. [A phone call] P : Hello, I'm so-and-so calling from Prudential. M : Yes? P : Have you thought about our plan? M : No. P : So, I'm just wondering, have you found a job yet? M : No. P : Would you be interested in.... M : No. P : There is a recruitment talk.... M : No. P : Oh ok. Thanks. Bye

Movie Review - Lara Croft: Tomb Raider The Cradle of Life Phew! What a mouthful. As promised, this is the review. Ass-kicking, gun-toting Lara Croft puts the grrr in "girl". With her sexy pout and smouldering eyes, she was certainly a sight to behold. Unlike Charlie's Angels, Lara did not waste time being all girly and giggly. No sirree, Ms Croft had better things to do with her time, and searching for Pandora's box was top on her agenda. She enlisted the help of an ex-flame cum mercenary cum traitor to the crown, Terri Sheridan (Gerard Butler), and with her two sidekick buddies (never knew their names), it was vital that she found the box first before Johnathan Reece (the bad scientist played by Ciaran Hinds). Plot There was some semblance of a plot, thin as it may be. As mentioned above, the main plot was to get to Pandora's box. Greek mythology was weaved into the movie. The movie started with Lara finding the ancient Lunar Temple, a temple built by Alex the great and was lost when some disaster occurred. The temple now lay underwater and no one ever found it until she came along. Chinese baddies followed her and took a glowing orb, which was the map to the location of the Cradle of Life where Pandora's box was kept. Baddies worked for Johnathan Reece who wanted the box so that he could sell it to other bad men for money. (Ahh, the wonders of greed) [Cut to the last bit:] Lara did find the Cradle of Life. Tapping to African mythology as well, the Cradle of Life was in some remote part of Africa, guarded by African tribesmen. Because Reece held her sidekick buddies hostage, she had to lead him to the Cradle of Life in order to save her friends. Of course, she found, and of course, she fought with Reese and killed him. But there is a slight twist. Along the way, somewhere in Hong Kong, she ditched Terri, fearing that he would betray her. La-di-da... he was at the Cradle of Life as well. Now, he wanted to bring the box back. (Think of the fortune that it was worth. The wonders of greed). But Lara said no. (More talking ensued) In the end, she killed him. Opinions and gripes It was highly entertaining although some parts were so ridiculous. Picture this, Lara slides down a rope and does not get rope burns. WTF? Or, a poor Chinese family living on a boat but they own a Panasonic flat screen TV. And lastly, an African tribesman in traditional African garb drives a SHINY jeep and carries a state-of-the-art mobile phone. RIDICULOUS. But entertaining nonetheless. Thankfully, dialogue was not cringeworthy and the audience was spared from unnecessary chatter. The movie was not overwhelmed with action sequences that attempted to mask the bare plot (think of Matrix Reloaded) and they were well executed. The scenery was certainly picturesque. Who needs to travel when you can visit Greece, remote parts of China, downtown Hong Kong and the desert regions of Africa by simply watching the movie? It was like a travel guide in disguise, not that I was complaining, of course. All in all, I enjoyed it, surprisingly. Flawed plot and improbable scenes aside, it was entertaining and Angelina Jolie did not annoy me. The fact that she looked so good was a bonus. I would actually pay $8.50 for it.

Movie Review - Vaanaprastham (The Last Dance) i watched this movie at e recently concluded indigo filmfest held at gv marina... n wldnt have even gone, had a fren, deeply moved by indian culture, not asked me along... apparently, e film was made by some top indian director (whose name i cant pronounce, much less spell) n e cinematographer is some reknowned french guy... despite all this, i had no idea wat to expect from an indian-french co-production, n after wacthing e movie, i can only describe it as being deeply profound... i read this review on IMDB, n felt dat it was excellent while mirroring many of my own views of e film, so i shall cut n paste it here... besides, i cant for e life of me remember nor spell e character's names or terms in e show, so i felt this wld be best in giving full credit to e filmmakers... I watched this film far after its release, but instantly saw it as a fantastic picture that showcased the unmitigated talent of both a masterful director and the finest actor India has ever produced. "Vanaprastham" tells the story of a revered Kathakali dancer named Kunhikuttan, who spends his life deeply longing for both the father whose identity is kept a mystery from him and the son he bore in an extramarital affair with a woman who loves only a character he plays on stage. Karun uses two cameramen for the film, the first is the renowned French cinematographer Renato Berta and the other is India's finest, Santosh Sivan. The result is a slightly disjointed stream in the visual tone of the film, but nonetheless produces some exquisite and meaningful vistas. The movie is indeed a quiet, visual poem that explores and reflects the ancient art of Kathakali dance, a sacred form of theater that originated and continues to flourish in the South Indian state of Kerala. In Kathakali, the artistes do not speak a word. Rather, they dance to music and make use of virtually hundreds of subtle facial and physical expressions to weave a tale- usually one of Hindu mythology. Shaji N. Karun tells Kunhikuttan's story in a similar manner; silent yet profound. Kunhikuttan is born to a low caste mother and a high caste Namboodiri (royalty) man who does not accept him as his son. As his life achingly passes by, he bears this burden on his shoulders along with a drinking problem that wears away at his reputation as the finest of Kathakali dancers. Married to a woman who despises him and tormented by a mother who drearily walks around with the secret of his father's identity, Kunhikuttan finds a chance for happiness in the arms of a married woman, Subhadra, who falls under the spell of his divine dance as the character of Arjuna. That happiness, he learns, is an illusion. In the twilight of his life Kunhikuttan, numbed by the pain he has endured all his life, takes a bold step as he prepares for a last dance. The film is about fathers and sons, about silence and speech and the space between. Karun weaves all the themes together seamlessly, and although the story is a bit ambiguous at times, the overall impact of the picture is stunning. Zakir Hussein's music is a vital part of creating the boundaries of silence and sound. At times furious and at times subtle, the genius of the composer can only be described as soul-stirring. It is the central performance of Mohanlal as Kunhikuttan, however, that breathes life into the picture and the character. We feel his burdens and his pain. We feel the triumph and fury of his characters on stage. Mohanlal learns Kathakali for this part, and the result adds to the multifacted brilliance of his remarkable portrayal. There is a progression that exudes through his face in the course of the narrative. From a curiosity, to a longing, to a rage, a depression a spirituality and finally to a peaceful sublime. The incredible range of this actor is in full display. Karun is intelligent enough to know this and make use of it. Here, Mohanlal won the National Film Award of India, won international acclaim at Cannes and other festivals, and in my opinion confirms his preeminence among both modern and classic Indian actors. The film, quiet and moving as it is, requires an actor to step up and use his body and his soul. In the end, the picture grows so quietly intimate and the performance so engaging, we can only sit in revered silence as the credits roll. hinducowz New York, NY My own thoughts: parts of e movie remain inexplicable cos of e great cultural divide, as i felt dat certain scenes n nuances have religious or social undertones unique to an indian culture, but alien to someone such as me... i doubt if any of u out there actually will have a chance of catching this movie, but if u do, pleees go watch it even if its 10 bucks...

Movie Review - Alex and Emma My turn to write a movie review. Before I begin, please do not think I actually paid to watch this show. Plot Another romantic comedy starring Kate Hudson (How To Lose A Guy In 10 Days) and Luke Wilson (Cameron Diaz's bf in Charlie's Angels) . Luke Wilson plays a writer, (oops, forgot his name), suffering from a bad case of writer's block. To make things worse for him, he owes money to a bunch of Cuban thugs. He has to write his book in 30 days in order to have get the money to pay those thugs back. Oh, by the way, the Cuban guys burnt his laptop, hence the need for a stenographer. This is where Kate Hudson's character, (Oh dammit, forgot her name as well) comes in. Blah blah blah, like all romantic comedies, you can definitely expect these 2 people to fall in love by the time the movie ends. Remarks This movie fails to deliver, unlike Kate Hudson's previous foray into this genre. How To Lose a Guy was a very enjoyable show and the easy chemistry between Kate and Matthew was a pleasure to behold. Kate perkiness, which was evident in her previous movie, is surprisingly absent. Instead of a sunny, blonde disposition, Kate is dark haired and mousy. Luke Wilson is also not as charming as Matthew McCounathingamajic (heh, dunno how to spell his name). There were some comedic bits though. I can vaguely remember laughing, but I cannot point out where those bits are in the show. On the whole.... Bleah, it was ok. A date movie, I suppose. Only die-hard fans of romantic comedies would look forward to watching the show. I wouldn't watch this show unless it's free. ps: I do enjoy watching romantic comedies. Unfortunately, many of them disappoint me. None have caught my attention since "The Truth About Cats and Dogs" . Funnily, I love that show, although it's no Memento. But then again, hardly any of the romantic comedies are.

Movie Review - Whale Rider whew... my 3rd movie in 2 wks... tink i gotta go easy on my movie urges now... those gal frens i watched wif pressured me into eating strawberries wif macs sundae during e show too... gotta admit its kinda yummy =p Synopsis: The story is told abt e journey of Paikea, sole surviving daughter (her twin bro was stillborn, n mother died after a difficult labor) of e future chief of a maori tribe. Abandoned by a father intent on pursuing his own dreams, Paikea strives to assume e mantle of chief, much to e chagrin of her grandfather, who despite his luv for his granddaughter, feels bound by patriachal traditions to reject her claim. Destiny and perseverance, however, have other ideas... Gripes: well... cld certainly do wif more subtitles as they spoke in maori for extended periods... felt an urge to understand e beauty of their prose, esp when they burst into their traditional songs Compliments: Keisha castle-hughes as e 12 yr old maori gal, was extremely convincing in her role... simple yet poignant performances cannot fail to move e audience... i noe most reviews discuss e film as a celebration of female emancipation n gal power or watever, but i do feel dat e true strength of e movie lies in e richness of its cultural portrayals, e struggle of a unique ppl determined not to be buried by e sands of time n western imperialism... as Paikea said herself (erm... i try to recall it word for word lah): i am Paikea, one in a long line of ancestors from Hawaiki... a ppl moving forward wif all our strength". A truly beautiful tale told at e pace n wif e spirit of a maori legend... Last words: if u ar a cultural movie buff, u cant miss this for all e world... pay 8.50 if u must

Games Review - The Sims Livin' Large Expansion Pack OOh. My first game review. I don't exactly know when this Expansion Pack (EP) was released, but it doesn't matter. Livin Large is basically an extension of the first game. New additions include more neighbourhoods, new clothes, more stuff to add to the homes and 5 new careers. After getting very bored with the first game, the new additions make the game alot more interesting. It is now possible to have themed homes or neighbourhoods. I tried creating a themed home and frankly, that was one of the ugliest homes I've created. It had medieval furniture, like wooden pews, candles and even a statue of a knight. Pretty cool, but it was utterly horrid to look at. Because I lost the Serial number of my first sims, I could never log in to the Sims site to download additional items, hence, I had to keep playing with the same things repeatedly. But this time round, I have problems activating my account. I hope it's going to be resolved soon so that I can design my own wallpaper and tile. Overall On the whole, definitely alot more interesting. One good thing about the Sims is that no 2 households are the same. Heh, I know this very well, since I have the game installed on 3 different computers cos each computer kept fucking up. Each time I installed the game, I kept trying to recreate my previous game but it never turns out the same. I would definitely buy the other EPs soon. :) Especially since I'm so free now, being unemployed and all.

Movie Review - City of God / Cidade de Deus i have no idea y im blogging so much lately... either im too free at home, or im finally doing something in my life worth toking abt... hmm... anyway, i tink cineleisure is e only theatre screening this movie, n im proud to say dat its also e 1st RA movie i've seen in e cinema since i turned 21... wow... tink e staff were trying hard not to laff when they checked my ic... heh Synopsis: a true story of gang wars n hoodlums in a slum near rio de janeiro, e film traces e life of 1 boy who grows up to be a photographer n leaves e cycle of poverty n drugs in e city of god. interspersed thruout e thread of his lifestory, ar sidetracks of e lives of others who were not as fortunate or determined in their struggles. Gripes: hmm... tink i'll write e compliments bit 1st b4 coming back to this... cant tink of any rite now Compliments: i kindof like e innovative method of injecting diff stories of other characters thruout e movie, sometimes wif flashbacks n at diff perspectives of e protagonists... even tho it may be abt e same event, but switching camera angles n all to show whose pt of view we ar at, makes it really cool, cos its e 1st time i've seen a movie take such a method to such lengths. based from e 60s to 70s, its soundtrack is also full of disco hits n tunes contemporous wif e times... sortof in accordance wif e whole style of e film - hippy, cool n vibrant... all this wifout any compromise on wat e movie is really all abt ie e brutality of life in e slums Conclusion: oops... tink i forgot to write any gripes... heheh... well, u go watch it n tell me if u dun like any part of e movie... its definitely worth 8.50

Music Review - The Complex by Blue Man Group for fans of dance-trance-chillout-lounge music ala moby, this is a muz buy, or at least, a muz listen if u arent familiar wif e grp, its ok, cos i wasnt either till last wk when i saw them being introduced on some cable music prog... they've apparently been ard for quite awhile... n erm, if u've seen a mtv wif 3 guys painted in blue striking weird mechanical gadgets, dats juz them playing their music wif their self-made musical instruments anyway, its hard to describe e genre of music it fits into, tho e urge to dance or simply jump according to its tunes n rhythm is almost unbearable... coupled wif surreal lyrics dat reflect e realities of our mundane lives, this is definitely not ur average music album out juz to please ur ears... personal fav tracks include Sing Along if i sing a song, will u sing along, or shld i juz keep singing right here by myself? if i tell u im strong, will u play along, or will u see im as insecure as everybody else? if i follow along does it mean i belong, or will i keep on feeling different than everybody else? Persona cld very well have been some modern poetry written in angst n self-discovery... so true... so real... every morning i put it on. i walk outside n im gone. i dun seem to mind anymore. i cant tink wat it was like b4 i wore it all e time. in e evening i take it off. but theres another underneath. n i cant seem to find e bottom of e stack. i might juz lose my mind n neva get it back, but at least i'll get inside. theres a feeling dat i get sometimes. its so small dat its easy to hide. its like a howling voice from e distant past. it seems i have no choice when it comes to this. its building up inside erm... i noe i've said i seldom buy cds... i bot this one n dun tink i'll ever regret doing so

MOVIE REVIEW - CHARLIE'S ANGELS: FULL THROTTLE There should be no expectations when one plans to watch a chick flick. Charlie's Angels is MOST definitely a chick flick. Fun, campy and downright ridiculous at times. I enjoyed it in a "that's so ridiculous, it's funny" sort of way. Plot Basically, the girls had to retrieve 2 rings which when placed together can de-code the names of people in the witness protection program. Very useful for mafia families. Think of Mission Impossible, where whats-his-face had to retrieve the NOC List. There are subplots as well, but too thin to even discuss in detail. Villains Demi Moore as Madison Lee is HOT. She looks so much better with her long flowing hair, than the bald 'do she had in GI Jane. There are bunch of other villains, like Drew's ex-boyfriend, dunno his character name, played by Justin Theroux. Great body, reminded me a little of Robbie Williams. There was also Ray Carter, played by the guy who was the metal man in Terminator. Other characters Bernie Mac annoyed me. Never found him funny. They should have gotten someone else to play that role. Crispin Glover as the thin man, was well, silent. Matt LeBlanc was very Joey-like. Gripes Aside from Bernie Mac, I don't have any main gripes. The action sequences are very Matrix-like, which makes it look like a rip-off. (heh, i guess, it's supposed to be a rip-off). Overall Ok lah. I mean, I enjoyed myself. I would only pay $6.50 for it though.

The night we went to the ball.... There was a point in time when balls were eagerly anticipated. Weeks and weeks of planning had to be done in order to get the perfect dress. Friends went together to have fun, couples took the opportunity to be on a romantic date, and everyone wanted to have a good time. Last night was no exception for the many people who turned up. Gowns of all colours, patterns and sizes paraded themselves in the ballroom. However, last night's event was lacking in atmosphere. The audience was rather bland and there was no air of excitement. Not many people were enthusiastic enough to participate in the games and many even left for photo opportunities outside during the performances. There was no festivities, aside from a smattering of "yam sengs" at the end of the night. The only time when everyone seemed interested in the happenings of the night was during the lucky draw where cries of "redraw" can be heard everytime there was a no-show by the owner of the number. DJ Rod Monteiro was the mc for the night. He was ok. Talked a little too much but unfortunately not terribly funny. My table was filled with a bunch of strangers. Two guys who kept to themselves, and 2 other couples who kept to each other. No one talked to each other. And or two even looked bored. No body in the ballroom danced when the dinner ended as they were too busy taking pictures. This was very different from my JC graduation night where the dance floor was packed with people dancing as soon as the VIPs left. Selin and I wanted to club, but unfortunately I had 2 huge blisters on my feet from wearing icky shoes (they were the only things that matched) so we went home at 12.30am. On the whole it was an ok night, not terribly exciting. We realised that even if more of our friends came, it wouldn't make that much of a difference, because the glory days of balls and graduation nights have come to an end for us a long time ago.
