Moview Review - Pirates of the Caribbean (2nd opinion) " Welcome to the Caribbean " And a lovely place it is. A lovely backdrop for a great movie as well. The plot : You want a detailed plot review? Well, I am disinclined to acquiesce to your request . The plot borders on being convoluted when being retold but surprisingly it makes perfect sense when one watches the movie. In short, Captain Barbossa ( urlLink Geoffrey Rush ) of the Black Pearl has been searching for the last gold doubloon so that he can end his curse. He and his mateys have been cursed to straddle two worlds; that of the living and the dead for stealing Aztec gold. They can't die but neither can they experience simple things like the taste of an apple. The gold lands in the hands of Elizabeth Swann ( urlLink Keira Knightley ) and she gets captured by Captain Barbossa. In comes Will Turner ( urlLink Orlando Bloom ), a humble blacksmith and Jake Sparrow ( urlLink Johnny Depp ), the worst pirate that ever came to Port Royale, to rescue the fair maiden. Some heavy duty canon action and sword fights plus ILM-generated effects complete the picture. Directed by Gore Verbinsky (The Ring, The Mexican) and produced by the American John Woo, Jerry Bruckheimer (Armageddon, Bad Boys, Pearl Harbour). The Characters : Without a doubt, Johnny Depp as Jack Sparrow stole the show. He single-handedly carried the movie with his portrayal of the mildly insane pirate with heavily lined eyes and braided hair. Jack Sparrow is a rogue through and through, but is definitely likeable. His morals are a little ambiguous but his love for the Black Pearl can't be questioned. Johnny Depp also got the best lines of the movie. Orlando Bloom shows us that he is as adept with swords as he is with a bow and arrow. As the straitlaced Will Turner, he is the 18th or 17th (I'm not sure which century is the movie set in) century version of a dork/nerd, which is very unlike the ultra-cool Legolas from the Lord of the Rings . Because Johnny Depp was so brilliant in the movie, he completely eclipsed his co-stars. Orlando's character seemed a little bland in comparison. But objectively speaking, he didn't do too badly. One can see his growth as the movie progresses, from a pirate-hater to a pirate-abetter as he accepted his past. Keira Knightley, made famous in Bend It Like Beckham , is absolutely gorgeous! Those breasts were partly enhanced by silicon bits, by the way. She pulled her role off well, and was not an irritating helpless maiden. On the contrary, she showed more spunk and girl power than Charlie's Angels . Fashion is of no use when one can't breathe in one's clothes right? Geoffrey Rush as the backstabbing first mate Barbossa was a delight to watch. He was villainous and mighty scary at times. That gravelly voice with the pirate accent can shiver my timbers. Other cast members like Captain Norrington ( urlLink Jack Davenport ) and Governor Swann ( urlLink Johnathan Pryce ) were competent in their roles. They didn't shake my boots because firstly, I wasn't wearing boots when I watched the show and secondly, watching Johnny Depp and drooling over Orlando Bloom took up all my attention. I loved the ship mates as well, the skeleton crew and the motley crew that Sparrow assembled. The Comments/Gripes : The movie was so enjoyable not only because of the strong cast, but because of other factors, namely dialogue, sets (props & costumes), musical score and special effects. How can a script penned by the very same guys who wrote Shrek fail? One can almost do a literature essay based on the dialogue which is filled with irony, puns, and a play with words. Credit must go to the cast who delivered their lines superbly. I loved the costumes, from Elizabeth's tight gowns to Commodore's stuffy military garb (or as Jack Davenport says "ice-cream costume") to Sparrow's unkempt outfit. The only thing I hated was that awful feather hat Turner used at the very end. Comic relief came in the form of 2 pirates, Pintel and Ragetti, a short balding pirate with his one-eyed lanky mate, the Laurel and Hardy of the movie. ILM (Industrial Light & Magic) helmed the special effects team. Creating the undead seems to be their speciality since they were behind the effects for " The Mummy ". The pirates' transition between human to rotting skeletons was seamless and the fighting scenes were captivating as they weaved in and out of the moonlight. In their true skeletal form, they were quite terrifying. Unfortunately, there were flaws in the movie. I felt that the chemistry between Keira and Orlando fizzled more than sizzled. Thank goodness the romance bit was played down and not that essential to the movie. The movie was also a tad too long. I know that it was essential to lay the plot out in detail, but when one is having gastric pains, sitting in a movie that is over 2 hours long isn't very pleasant. The verdict : I watched it twice and paid a grand total of $14. So, I'm sure that $8.50 shouldn't be a problem at all. "Yes, she's safe as I promised, she's going to marry the Commadore as she promised, and you're going to die for her as you promised. You see we're all men of honor, except Elizabeth, who is, in fact, a woman." - Jack Sparrow to Will Turner. Yo Ho, Yo Ho, A Pirate's Life for Me We pillage and plunder, we rifle and loot, drink up me hearties, Yo Ho. We kidnap and ravish and don't give a hoot, drink up me hearties, Yo Ho. We extort and pilfer, we filch and sack, drink up me hearties, Yo Ho. Maraud and embezzle and even highjack drink up me hearties, Yo Ho. Yo Ho, Yo Ho, A Pirate's Life for Me

Movie Review - Savvy? Went to catch this highly-proclaimed-busted-over-$300-million-movie-at-the-US-box-office-over-the-weekend movie on Friday. I must say, that if I wasn't threatened and coerced into watching this, I would never have gone to watch it, for the following reasons: 1) I think Orlando Bloom looks 'hello' lots better as a blonde with long hair and pointy ears and with archery skills better than robin hood any knighty ol' day; 2) The whole show's trailer just reeked like a rip-off of Lord of the Rings, for the mere fact of a key character and the plot which involved war with the undead; and 3) There didn't seem like a great pulling reason to just watch it - sure, the plot is the kind of adventure I like, but there's always kazaa.... Anyway, despite all misgivings , I watched the show. And didn't regret it one bit. Why.... 1) Johnny Depp - from Edward Scissorhands to Donny Brasco to Don Juan Demarco to Chocolat, this actor has never dominated the entertainment news for any bad-boy actions or ego attitude. In fact, the roles he chooses to undertake are few and far between, and are often roles that emphasize on deep character-building. This boy is a serious actor, I tell you. No typical type-casting on him - he can do romance to mafia to poor-boy and comedy. As Captain Jack Sparrow of the Black Pearl, his role is mainly comical and yet remains crucial to the whole plot. With eyes kohl-lined more heavily than golden retrievers, a beheft appearance that onscreen looks as if he really smells and looks as disgusting as he does and walking and talking with the swagger and drawl, he's just my kind of pirate and gypsy. Bloke has an upcoming role in Desperado II - Once upon a Time in Mexico, which reunites Antonio Banderas and Salma 'hot' Hayek. Am lookin' so forward to that one. 2) Great swordfighting and swashbuckling actions. As far as pirates and buckaneers go, this show packs great swordfights and bucaneering canon action worth the price of admission alone. 3) Amazing CGI effects. Especially proven in the showdown scene where the cursed pirates and the good guys are fighting in a cave with a roof that streams the moonlight in. Watch out for how the figures change into skeletons and humans as they weave in and out of the moonlight. 4) Jack Davenport, Keira Knightley and Jonathan Pryce. It didn't click to me that Jack Davenport was the guy I massively had a crush on after watching The Talented Mr. Ripley. (i watched the show twice coz of that) And, to say most unabashingly, I like the guy all over again. It must be his kind, gentle, softspoken characters. Keira is only 18 and looks hell great, and I'm almost envious of that. But she did not to bad in the show and it's a mighty lot different from her stint in Bend It Like Beckham. Jonathan Pryce; great actor, no worries there. Go catch the show. "Nuff Said.
Gah! I'm SICK!!! Ugh. That's all I can write for today.

Stripped Do you know who you really are? When you look into the mirror, do you actually see your true self? I'm not talking about physical appearances. Look beyond that. Can you find your very being or have you been hiding behind so many facades that you can't recognise yourself anymore? Look at yourself. What do you see? The clown? The queen? The idealist? The romantic? The loner? The intellect? So many pigeon-holes, but do you actually belong there? You have been described in so many ways by so many people claiming to know you. But how much of it is actually you and how much is what you portray yourself to be? Are you really sociable because you enjoy the interaction with other people or because you like the attention focused on you? Are you are funny not because you like to make people laugh but because you would rather have people laughing at your jokes than at you? Have you inadvertently created so many smoke screens that you forget who you are? More importantly, when you do see yourself, do you like what you see? Strip away the facades and leave ego and pride hanging at the door. Can you stand to look at yourself or would you rather hide behind the many faces of you so you don't have to see yourself stripped to the core again?

In urlLink April amid not so much fanfare, the blog had a major revamp and the name was changed to its current one (again all thanks to Morgan). Midweek News It's a WEDNESDAY! Since I've pushed my tuition to Sat, I have decided to blog today. I've got a couple of reviews due and I'll just tackle the short ones today. 1) urlLink IGOR'S - One of the few (or is it the only one?) themed restaurants in Singapore. As you eat, you will be entertained by the musical performance on stage. I must say, I definitely enjoyed myself that night. Guests are required to take a walk through the haunted castle before entering the dining hall. Along the way, ghouls, vampires, little devils and Frankenstein will greet you. First, I was very impressed with the crew. They wear many different hats (metaphorically speaking of course) during the course of the show-cum-meal. They take your attendance, lead you through the castle and also serve you.

urlLink Are you hot? Ahh.. more trash to pollute our minds with. Thanks to urlLink ABC for producing this show and many thanks to Mediacorp for importing it to Singapore. The search is on for America's sexiest people. In the vein of American Idol, thousands of people gathered at various points in the USofA to participate in this new reality tv shwo. Talent, personality and intelligence are not needed, only a hot body and a reasonably good looking face. Similar to Amercain Idol, 3 judges will determine if you're hot or not. You have Lorenzo Lamas (yes, he is still alive), he who acted in old tv shows like Renegade and Falcon Crest. Then you have Rachel Hunter, she who used to be married to Rod Stewart and also the token Brit (a la Cowell) in the show. Lastly, meet Randolph Duke, designer to the stars. And, just like American Idol, you have the gorgeous and the down-right hideous taking part . No surprises there - breasts, butts and biceps the size of melons galore. Unfortunately, most of the time, intelligence and personality were inversely proportional to the physical attributes. The gem of the show, SURPRISINGLY, was the judges. All three of them had a clear idea of what was hot and the put-downs that contestants received were priceless. Comments on breast size, buts, clothes and facial features were hilarious. All three judges showed some semblence of wit, unlike Paula "Wash-out" Abdul. "Don't distract me with your stupidity. Just shut up and let me look at you." To a lady with breasts as big as her butt: "Did you get implants to balance out your ass?" Lady: Yes Judge: Well, I would have gone the other way. I would have gotten some reduction work instead. Arrogance was a big turn off for the judges. Apparently, the judges weren't impressed by skankily dressed females either. "When I look at you, two words come to my mind. How much." Hee... such frank comments. I definitely enjoyed myself, largely due to the judges and not the body.
Must lose weight.

More Mindless Babbles The end of the year is approaching and I doubt I am going to win my bet anytime before 31 Dec 2003. But fortunately for me, I don't think I'm going to have to pay anything as well. You see, my friend and I made bets that one of us would get attached by the year's end before the other. Meaning, I bet that she would get attached first and vice versa. If I won it, she would give me a treat and vice versa as well. Heh, we aren't any closer to winning our bets.

Mindless Babbles Long weekends are absolutely faantastic . An extra day for simply not doing anything at all. Gosh. I love it. So what did I do these past few days? Friday was fucked up. Had the most awful cramps, backache and headache ever. The curse of being a female. Ugh. Saturday was truly a " tai tai " (how does one say that in English?) day. I had my hair done! I cut and coloured it. However, neither the haircut nor the colour was shocking enough. So, now my hair is short and dyed a deep copper red. I would probably streak it soon. After my looooong hair appointment, which cost me a lot of money, I wasted more money by paying $8.50 to watch the movie, " Identity ". A review will be done when I'm in the mood. So don't hold your breath for it yet. And today, this glorious Sunday, I was supposed to meet friends for lunch. But, one had to cancel, and Daniel "I sat on a turret" Tham and I decided to just cancel the entire lunch thing. I have done absolutely nothing ever since I woke. Heck, I'm still in my PJs even as I'm writing this blog. My mom is in despair that her only daughter behaves like a pig. She keeps saying that no man wants a stinky, bad-table manners (hee, cos I accidentally burped really loudly at the dinner table) and lazy girl. To which I replied, if he can't take stinky ol me, then I probably wouldn't want him anyway. Well, tomorrow is the official start date for the fasting month. Yes.. it begins again. A whole month of fasting, after which, I can pig out on delicious food and cakes. I'm looking forward to it actually. It being the fasting and not the feasting. Well, feasting is great, but think of the calories! Time to get used to waking up at ungodly hours in the mornings to eat. My mom is insisting that I eat half-boiled eggs (YUCK!) every morning. I hope she isn't going to boil any for me. Half boiled eggs are the grossest things on earth. Neither raw nor cooked, they're just so gooey and slimy and they taste horrible. Sigh. I didn't get to watch Kill Bill after all. Neither did I get to watch the Italian Job . I'll just go rent the VCD or something. I'm going to miss urlLink Havana Night , which is such a bummer cos I already missed urlLink Lady Salsa . I'm going to miss the entire FRENCH FILM FESTIVAL . Sob.

Movie Review - American Pie: The Wedding After a two-year hiatus, we get to meet our horny teens (now adults) again. We have seen them through prom, then college and now, they are about to join the working world after graduating from college. Plot Jim (Jason Biggs), the self-confessed perv, is about to propose to Michelle (Alyson Hannigan), his self-confessed nympho girlfriend, at a restaurant one night. But somehow, Michelle assumes that he wants to do something kinky and procedes to give him a blow job from under the table. Things go down-hill when Jim's dad, brilliantly played by Eugene Levy, drives over informing him that he forgot to bring the ring. What follows is one of the funniest and double entendre-filled lines from the movie. Wedding preparations begin. We get to meet Finch (Eddie Kay Thomas), Kevin (Thomas Ian Nicholas) and Stifler (Seann William Scott). New additions to the cast came in the form of Cadence (January Jones), Michelle's virginal sister, Michelle's parents and a big gay man called "Bear". The wedding preparation is a thinly-disguised attempt to string the various gags together. Jim, in hopes of impressing his fiancee, drives all the way to Chicago with his friends to get her the perfect dress. Told that the dressmaker is in one of the bars, they split up looking for a certain Leslie something-or-other. Stifler ended up in a gay bar, and had a dance showdown with Bear, which was absolutely hilarious. Other subplots include, Finch and Stifler "swapping" personalities in order to attract Cadence. Characters: The cast has definitely aged a little more since the last time we saw them. Finch, while still intellectually cool, has become chubbier. Kevin is barely noticeable, especially with his lack of dialogue. But then again, he is one of the more boring characters in the trilogy. Stifler is still as rude and loud-mouthed as ever. Missing from the cast is Oz (Chris Klein), his girlfriend, Heather (Mena Suvari), Jessica (Natasha Lyonne), Nadia (Shannon Elizabeth) and Vicky (Tara Reid). No mention was given as to why they couldn't attend the wedding. Jim and girl are still the same. Eugene Levy as the father definitely stole every scene that he was in and he was still dispensing unwanted advice. "Your mother, bless her, can still make me squeal like a pig." Hee. Opinions and gripes: This third instalment brings back the memories of the first American Pie, gross humour but with heart. While there is no semblance of the plot, some scenes are just achingly funny and when one laughs, one really laughs. In between the funny scenes, unfortunately, the rest of the movie does not quite live up to the expectations (if one has any) of the first American Pie. Stifler, that dickhead, is definitely the highlight of the show. Doggy doo, dog molestation and grandmother fucking are just some of the situations that he gets himself into in the course of the 90 mins show. It is obvious that the funny/gross scenes are only added to generate laughter and have no impact on the entire movie whatsoever. One example: Jim shaves his balls and procedes to throw the hair outside the window (what the fuck?). The hair then gets sucked into the ventilator and enters the kitchen of the hotel, thus rendering his wedding cake useless. No point at all, but it was certainly grossly funny. The cast, by now, are very familiar with their roles and they carry it off well. While some characters, namely Kevin, had no development at all, others, like Stifler, were given the chance to strut their stuff. And strut they did. In the case of Stifler, he danced, fucked and ate shit all in one show. The movie does get tiresome at times. Too much of Stifler is NOT a good thing. But the funny scenes are enough to sustain the audience throughout the duration of the movie. The best line of the show has got to be from Stifler. When told that he just fucked a grandmother (go watch to find out why), he said, "Pussy is pussy." Overall: I would pay $6.50 to watch.

Wedding of the year? Well, look who got married during the weekend? The over-exposed couple, Pierre Png and his liver-less (well, the liver isn't hers) fiancee (now wife), Andrea De Cruz. Or they could also be known as the local "Bennifer". He can't act (just like Ben Affleck) and she is just annoying (like J.Lo). For "B-grade" actors (hee, I got this from Sunday's NewPaper), they have certainly received more than their fair share of column space and tv air time. For small time actors, their wedding certainly rivaled that of Hollywood weddings. A grand total of $644,000 was spent, although to be fair to them, about half came in the form of sponsorships. Bridesmaids' gowns, grooms' suits and flower decorations were among the many items that were sponsored. For "private people", they sure as hell knew alot of people to invite to their wedding dinner, 650 guests to be exact. In true Hollywood style, the press was barred from the ballroom because they wished to keep their wedding "private". Everybody join me in saying, "Yeah. Right." The only thing that was missing from the wedding was the press helicopters circling the church and hotel, trying to get the "Exclusive" on their wedding. In all honesty, this whole shindig isn't even necessary. No one outside our tiny island would give a fuck about Pierre and Andrea. But everybody seems to love them especially after the whole fiasco about her poisoned liver and the great, romantic rescue by Pierre, in the form of his liver. However, the reason why she ended up with a poisoned liver was because she wanted to lose weight and bought slimming pills which turned out to be toxic. Yeah.. Yeah, I'm just bitchin.

Movie Review - A Time For Dancing Ugh. Crappy movie alert. The ad in the papers advertised the movie as being similar to "Flashdance" and "Dirty Dancing". Starring Shiri Appleby (Roswell), Larisa Oleynik (10 Things I Hate About You) and Shane West (LXG), this movie centers primarily around 2 best friends, Jules (Larisa) and Sam (Shiri) who are also dancers. Jules is the perfect prima ballerina and she aspires to get into Julliard (like all dance movies, every teen wants to get into Julliard) while Sam is just mucking around. Blah blah blah, Jules gets diagnosed with cancer during one of her routine medical check ups. In time, she has to stop dancing and go for intensive chemotherapy. Sam meets cute dude, Paul played by Shane West in one of his run-of-the-mill teeny roles again. Paul barely has enough screen time to merit a character analysis. Characters: Larisa Oleynik looks wholesome and she can actually dance, as seen from the uncut footage that featured her dancing. I daresay, she dances better than Julia Stiles in Save the Last Dance. Trivia: Both actresses appeared in 10 Things I Hate About You. Shiri Appleby is just meh. Well, both of them are just meh. But Shiri is more bleah. She's pretty though but she can't dance and has a dance double. Overall: Meh. And too sappy for my liking. In case you wanted to know, Jules died in the end. Rating: Pay for me and I'll watch. Unfortunately, I paid $8.50 for it. Sigh.

When being 7 is no longer cute.... Hurrah! I'm back! [all hail the great nephthys] Now, back to my topic: Kids. Currently the bane of my life, having gotten stuck with 8 kids 5 of which/ whom (?) are under 8 years old. As young as they may look, they possess very adult-like behaviour and personality, namely bitchiness. It is awfully disconcerting listening to a young girl blowing her own trumpet and dissing other people. Example: Girl: I got 95 for Maths. My sister is very bad at Maths. She always fail her tests. She is slow and lazy. Girl: My father is a lazy pig. Girl: Look at my handwriting. My friend's handwriting is very small. She always get scolded by the teacher. But I have never been scolded before. Even worse, a 7 year old girl who has a HUGE ego and refuses to do any corrections because she prefers to erase her wrong answers to make them right so that there aren't any crosses in her book. (Of course, this ridiculous request was not granted by me.) The final straw came about when said girl forced tears to roll down her cheeks because I pointed out that one of her answers was wrong. For the next 20 minutes or so, she was silently crying while her mother alternated between asking her what's wrong and getting her to do her work. She did neither. While I watched and counted the mintues till I got home. Heartless as this may sound, but I believe the girl was just trying to attract attention. It is such a pain working with kids.

Movie Review - Matrix Revolutions hmm... my 1st date wif my crush, so i was understandably a little distracted.... ;ppp in any case, i was irritated by e kids who filled e theatre cos they kept gasping n moaning at exciting or gross scenes... they even applauded in e end.. sheesh... Synopsis: erm... a continuation of Matrix Reloaded... so if u remember, Neo went into a coma n turns out dat hes stuck in a train station (a place b/w e real world n e matrix)... kindof like purgatory for e catholics... trinity n morpheus saves him n brings him back to e real world, Neo gets out of his coma n travels to machine city (aka e source).. while zion attempts to defend against an invasion... Neo, of cos, saves e day by negotiating peace wif e machines... n e war is over... for now... Gripes: well... if u tot matrix reloaded made no sense... this instalment is much much worse... any attempt to rationalise e plot leaves u wif a headache n more HUH??!s then u'll ever get by watching any other movie... e worst part was when they tried to explain y e Oracle doesnt look e same anymore (e real actress died during filming, so they had to get a replacement)... there ar so many illogical bits, dat 1 wunders if e wachowski bros were intentionally trying to make e audience go HUH, or simply trying too hard to look like geniuses by bringing up e age-old philosophies of life's purpose n direction... Compliments: e action sequences n visual effects were cool to say e least... not e do-or-die battle b/w agent smith n neo, but e battle scene in zion itself... ironic dat humans still had to rely on machines (resembling those from gundam) to fight machines tho... i'd also like to give agent smith a pat on e back for being utterly convincing in his evil laughter... erm.. u'll understand once u watch it =p All in all: juz enjoy e action n cool scenes wifout bothering abt e logic, n erm... enjoy e company of e person u ar watching wif... err... ahem... yah... dats abt all u can get to like abt e film... 8.50 wld be juz abt alrite...

Movie Review - Kill Bill Vol. 1 well... its been some time since my last review n erm... stop pressuring me! im aredi writing one now, aint i?!?! anyway, was really a weird day at lido... saw wong lilin n allan wu, some smalltime channel 8 actor wif his gf, my fren's fren, n my fren... e theatre sure was crowded wif familiar ppl on a thurs afternoon.... Synopsis: erm... a simple plot runs thruout e film ie kill bill... im sure u muz have read in e papers (u cant miss those posters of her wif a samurai sword) abt uma thurman (aka black mamba aka *beep*) being "killed" by her fellow assasins (e deadly vipers assasination squad), except she din really die n after coming out of a coma 4 yrs later, goes on a rampage to exact revenge... in this 1st vol, she kills lucy liu (aka cotton mouth aka O'Ren Ishiii) n vivica fox (aka Copperhead aka vernita green). n errr.. yah, dats all there is to e story Gripes: ok, i noe e critics went gaga over e movie n lotsof ppl have said they liked it (most of them gals), but i gotta say a movie richly laced wif pulp culture but supported by a thin (dats really an understatement... im tinking more of zero) plot development doesnt go down well for me... there wasnt much space for e cast to perform anyway, since its mainly an action movie, so i cant comment on any convincing or moving portrayals... fight scenes got boring after awhile cos of repetitive n overuse of e same methods of decapitation, mutilation n showerhead bloodspurts (yes, i really do mean showerhead)... e gore n violence promised by reviews neva materialised since it was more comical n funny than visually shocking (in part due to tarantino's obsession wif pulp culture in e film)... if this movie is gory, then saving private ryan muz have been totally gut-wrenching... n thanx to e non-existent plot, everything was totally predictable ie uma thurman won every fight, lost e least blood n killed hundreds of henchmen, juz like ur typical comic bk superhero (another influence of pulp culture)... how many times have i mentioned e P n C words aredi??? e movie also sorely lacked originality, since those showerhead bloodspurts were imitations of early period american horror n hk martial art flicks... uma thurman was dressed like bruce lee n u even had a jap bodyguard in highsch uniform n gothic makeup... it juz reeks of tarantino playing out his own fantasies abt pulp culture in e movie... martial art choreography is so-so n nothing new, given dat e choreographer is yuen ho ping, n we muz have seen too much of his werks since crouching tiger... sheesh.. i muz really hate this movie.. hahaa Compliments: well... thanx to pulp culture (again), we got 3 nice things to admire in e film... 1, e funky disco-ish soundtrack (which i have tried to d/l)... 2, some nice editing of frames n scenes... 3, a short seqeunce of japanese-styled animation which was surprising n truly entertaining... All in all ok, besides those 3 things i mentioned under compliments, there really isnt much to look forward to in e film, unless u ar a fan of retro pulp culture (darn i said it again), n judging by wat my female frens have said abt it, gals seem to have an affinity for this sortof thing... i tink i mentioned b4 dat im a sucker for gd plot developments, which i tink shld be e core of any movie (its a provocative n novel storyline dat wld make a movie stick in ur mind for life, not some funky music or retro colors), n since KillBill is apparently lacking in it, i have to say i shall d/l vol 2... i paid 6.50 n felt dat tarantino (aka overhyped 1 hit wonder in Pulp Fiction) owes me a refund...

Movie Review (Part Deux) - Love Me If You Dare (LMIYD) Staying true to my word of getting my reviews out before LOTR, the last movie I watched before KHNH was Love Me If You Dare aka urlLink Jeux D'enfants . As many would have urlLink read , this movie is billed as the "next" urlLink Amelie . Well, it's more like a darker, more perversed version of Amelie. This movie stars urlLink Marion Cotillard (the girl in "Taxi", I'm guessin' she was Daniel's girfriend and not Petra) as Sophie and urlLink Guillaume Canet (the guy from "The Beach", I'm guessin' that French girl's boyfriend, but I seriously wouldn't know) as Julien. Best friends since young, the two have been inseparable and constantly play a game of dare. When still in the stages of childhood, daring each other to "pee in the principal's office" or "wreck a sister's wedding" is awfully funny. When in teenage-hood, the dares don't seem as funny and borders on being mean. BUT when in adulthood, it is just SICK. Somehow, they do fall in love but they have been playing their game for so long that they never confess their feelings (without kidding around) till the very end. The movie was definitely good. The use of bright colours and various fantasy-like sequences remind viewers of Amelie. But that is where the similarity ends. While Amelie focuses on good deeds and has an overall feel-good aura, LMIYD is disturbing. The love between the two leads is deep despite their attempts to bury it. The two friends also think of ways to hurt the other, by a) humiliation b) ruining a wedding and c) faking a terrible a car accident. And yet, one seems to hope that they will end up together, if not for love, but to put an end to all those "childish" games, hence the title jeux d'enfants. They do end up together, but not in the way you would think. Disturbing. It was enjoyable but definitely disturbing, set to the tune of "La Vie En Rose". Kudos to the two young stars who played Sophie and Julien as kids. I would definitely pay $8.50 to watch it. Cap? Pas Cap?

*Peeks out from under the table* Has it been over 2 weeks since i last blogged?? hee, I was supposed to finish writing my review of love actually , but I never got round to doing it. *sheepish smile* And now, I have 3 movies to review, all of which I had better write before I watch LOTR - Return of the King next week. Because of the numerous movies I'm reviewing, I'll not do a detailed review. Besides, I'm sure none of you are interested in reading a detailed review anyway since tons of them can be found on the Net or in newspapers. Most recent movie: Kal Ho Naa Ho (KHNH) Yup, I just got back from my first Hindi movie at a theatre. Usually, I just borrow VCDs and watch them and I don't watch Hindi movies very often. Kal Ho Naa Ho stars the oh-so-famous Shah Rukh Khan. Like most Hindi films, KHNH is essentially a love story. Set in New York and tells the tale of a three friends and their families. And like most Hindi films, retelling the plot is a bitch because it is so damn convoluted and has too many characters. So read the urlLink link for more details. I'm just going to add my two cents worth. I can't pretend to be a connoiseur of Hindi movies because I average about one every 3 years. Any-hoo, I enjoyed this movie. The dialogue was surprisingly funny with tons of cheesy jokes, which I don't usually tolerate but, I would rather hear bad jokes than sappy dialogue. The plot didn't have too many loopholes (none that I can remember of hand) and the acting wasn't stilted. It helps, of course, if the actors are good looking and Saif Ali Khan most definitely was. Moving on... The music and dancing was certainly entertaining. There was actually a tragedy (yes someone died), and the ending was bittersweet. Not bad for a movie over 3 hours long. Boy, was it long. Overall: It was good. Can't give a price rating cos all Hindi movies cost $10. Heh.

Movie Review - Freeze Me okie... was supposed to be attending real estate finance lect, but hey, its e eve of e eve of CNY! gimme a break! Synopsis: Chihiro is a simple girl that wants to have a handful of happiness like everyone else. She has a fiance and a nice apartment where she can carry on in her private life without any worries in the world. But she has a dark secret, a rape that happened between her and three men from her hometown 5 yrs ago (hence coming to tokyo in a bid to escape those memories n rebuild her life). When these men begin appearing again one by one in her life, as they seek to recreate their past experiences wif her, Chihiro finally has to face her fears of losing her fiance, her rebuilt life in tokyo, n everything of significance to her... My Thoughts: well... i've read some reviews of e show n most werent impressed by it, describing it as an erotic thriller (there were a no of sex scenes) shallow in e psyche of rape victims, sexploitation (to coin e term used by ong sor fen of ST), dark comedy etc... however, all of them seem to miss out on wat i view to be an essential element thruout e film, dat every event was a direct culmination of wat occured juz b4... n Chihiro was simply caught up in e frenzy of it all, helpless against e swirl of circumstances... to escape her dark past, she came to tokyo to rebuild her life, n when 1 of her rapists showed up, she did all she cld to prevent him from revealing e episode n shattering her new life... surely u wld have felt e same despair when ur fiance discovers e truth n walks away from ur apartment wif ur rapist laffing in ur living room? wld anyone not have done e same as she had, by trying to make everyone who destroyed her life disappear? This is a poignant tale of how a gal (or indeed anyone) whos escapist in attitude, struggles to find a way out of a growing mess... e scary thing is it cld happen to anyone... wld u do e same? Compliments: some reviews said e lead actress was miscast, n i have to disagree on dat, since she was totally convincing in her role as a happy-go-lucky individual trying to get on wif life as she knows n wants it to be... it also bears e hallmark of contemporary jap thrillers, wif those grainy screenshots n dark corridors... these when coupled wif e mildly gorry images of blood (as she whacks them on e head wif an assortment of blunt instruments) shld be enuf to make most audiences cringe in some scenes... but like i said, e main draw of e movie isnt e usual screams or lurking shadows. it lies in e whole psychological transformation of Chihiro n her actions, which were made to look inevitable n justified... Gripes: ok... maybe shld have cut down on some sex scenes cos some were too drawn out n looked too much like a porno flick in parts (imagine Unfaithful but wif more nudity n action)... All in all: u may not agree wif my analysis of e movie, but if u do trust me (i neva watch lousy shows in e cinema!), its a relatively gd watch at 8.50, considering there arent many gd shows on offer now anyway

Movie Review - Goodbye Lenin! my 1st movie since lotr! lots of germans were in e theatre wif me, which made me wunder if im e foreigner watching a german film in s'pore... hmm... Synopsis: Alex's mum went into a coma on e eve of e fall of e berlin wall, n awakes 8 mnths later after massive social devts have occurred in which germany becomes a united capitalist nation. As she was a staunch commie, Alex tries to con his mum into tinking dat they ar still living in e old communist German Democratic Republic, for fear dat his mum might suffer another heart attack... Compliments: a dark comedy portraying e contrasting lives b/w east n west germany of e times, e film succeeds in satirising e whole event, despite potentially profound political/emotional undercurrents. From e typical west german who takes everything in life for granted, to e plight of Alex's family as they struggle to adapt to a new capitalist system, e whole movie is a montage of multi-faceted views of east germany in dat era. Performances by a strong cast add further credibilty to e story, n it shld be enjoyed by historians n e layman alike. Gripes: too bad i cant understand german, cos there were parts when e german audience was laffing n i cldnt get e joke from e subtitles... grrr..... n i guess e cinematography n editing cld have been done more creatively... nothing new there plus e soundtrack is quite stale n i cldnt remember any tune from it at all. All in all: its entertaining n mildly provocative, n shld be well worth 8.50.... tho im extra happy dat i paid 6.50 for it!
WoW - you went India and I went Sydney! Is india nice? I'd never think of it as a holiday destination!

2-in-1 Movie Review! ooh... now dat e blog has finally sprung back to life, its time for more move reviews! well... 2-in-1 cos im lazy n erm.. yah, dats abt e only reason =p Last Life in the Universe if u luv quirky, original stories, this wld be ideal... e movie at 1st sight seems largely unspectacular cos of its unexciting storyline (a jap guy meets a thai gal n they fall in luv)... but wat captivates audiences is indeed e plot itself, which at times blur e lines b/w reality n imagination of its individual characters... n i haven even mentioned e mildly funny dialogue n belieavable performances by the japanese n thai cast (of whom e female lead is a real looker)... so erm... i tink its quite hard to hate e show, unless u ar some anti-jap or anti-thai person... Mystic River another powerful story wif an all-star cast... wat movie can fail wif sean penn, kevin bacon n clint eastwood as e director? even tim robbins got his breakthru role in this film... a definite winner for best supporting actor... its a movie littered wif emotional upheavals, subtleties n clues for e audience to discover for him/herself (it is afterall a suspense thriller) n even has a certain moral undertone thrown in... extremely heavygoing material set into e plot of a classic murder investigation... if u watched Sleepers (wif brad pitt n kevin bacon n some other ppl i cant remember) n liked it, u cant miss Mistic River... oh.. also realised something weird while searching for pics from e movie.. e 3 chilhood frens neva appear in e same scene as adults thruout e film...

American Idol: My Own Two Cents Up to this point, four people have made it through to the next round. Since season 3 began, I've not yet made my comments about the show. Auditions were hilarious, as usual, although I found season 2 to be more memorable. The Hates: I HATED and I mean HATED Scooter Girl. Nothing you can say can or will ever make me like her. Granted, she does have a fair amount of singing talent but she is just SO annoying! That exaggerated facial expression, the stupid scooter and who does acrobats on that scooter anyway? Needless to say, Nephthys was extremely pleased that scooter girl scooted out of the show. (I pray that she won't be invited back to the wild card round.) I HATED smarmy Michael Keowyn as well. It's just not natural to love yourself that much. I also HATED Ms Boobs, Katie Webber. For some reason (I think it was her breasts), she annoyed me. Yes, she can sing and yes, she does look cute. But the problem, I think, is that she knows it. The Likes I actually wanted to like that cute, man-ish girl, Briana. However, Mediacorp did not telecast the episode featuring the good auditions, so I didn't get a chance to hear her sing. Unfortunately, the only time I heard her sing was in Group 2. No one should ever cover songs by Norah Jones, especially not when one wears suspenders and looks like a boy. I liked the pen salesman, only because he looks cute, in a pen-salesman sorta way. Can't wait for group 3 because the pen salesman is going to be singing. Yay!

The Cold War I'm not talking about the cold war that occurred decades ago, but the "wars" my mom and I get into from time to time. Fighting with my mom can be a pain. Sometimes, the fault lies with me for various reasons namely late nights, bad grades and the occasional rude behaviour. But this time round, I firmly believe the fault lies with her. The fight starts with either a loooong rant by queen B herself or a blow-up, but that rarely occurs. Tuesday's incident started with a blow-up with each ranting out their points but the other not listening and refusing to give in. I still maintain that the fault does not lie with me (and I've spoken to various people about it). So anyway, right now it's degraded to plain silence. Icy on Tuesday morning, but now it's just silence. We talk to the rest of the family as normal but conversations between me and her? Heh, she moves into another room when I come in and we don't even take the same lift down in the mornings. On my part, I avoid looking at her whenever possible. It is ridiculous to note that the fight is about food. I don't know when the cold war will blow over. In the meantime, it just gets easier to avoid.

And she's back Oh look who's back! It's ME!! (fanfare all around) Feels good to blog again. In case anyone is actually wondering, I've been too lazy to blog and work was driving me nuts. Stress due to the work and stress due to money are two different things. While working in a small firm has its perks (namely flexible time, easy-going bosses), cashflow does get pretty tight. Having to delay payments to supplier gets awfully exhausting when they keep hounding one for money. Added to that, disgruntled employees whose wages are delayed (this includes yours truly). Anything that goes wrong financially in the company, the accounts/finance department is the first casualty in the finger-pointing game. And who makes up the acct/finance dept? Yours truly again. Sigh. Well, now, my motto is "Don't give a fuck". Thus, life is much more pleasant. Not only that, my fave tv shows are BAACK!!! urlLink Survivor: All-Stars and urlLink American Idol !! Survivor - I caught only the debut episode on Monday, but missed the second one yesterday. I must say it's really great to see previous contestants again. American Idol - Hee, where do I begin? I was afraid that I would not like this year's contestants because I grew so fond of those on AI2, even those horrid ones like Keith and Edgar. But this year's batch have yet to disappoint me. The new "Keith" has got to be urlLink William Hung . I mean, who can forget "She Bangs" as sung by him? Adorable. This year's fame whores (trademark urlLink Shack ) are even more delusional than the previous 2 seasons. Hee, and it makes good tv to watch them get slammed by Simon. Updates on my life: As usual :) I outgrew my crush!! Yay!!! Why? Well, he's a jackass. 'Nuff said. I watched "Irreversible" last night. Yup, that French movie. Disturbing is a mild way of describing that show. I usually have a high tolerance level for disgusting stuff. Blood, gore, people getting killed; I love them all. But the infamous 10 minute rape scene almost had me rushing to the nearest W.C to puke. Any longer and I would have puked. One doesn't get to see any more than a breast and a peek at the rapist's penis, but the uncut scene (shot from the same angle throughout) was highly disturbing. Shudder.

Well it is certainly nice to know that this charity foundation has a cool $189 million in reserves, enough to tide it over for the next 3 years without anyone donating. And it is also nice to know that 52 cents out of every dollar goes to those who actually need it and the remaining 48 cents used to run the non-profit organization. This is the same charity foundation that I donate to almost every month via GIRO deduction and during my days as a POOR university student, the said foundation had the cheek to ask me to top up my bank so that GIRO deductions would be successful because they will incur bank costs for failed deductions. My dad donates $27 a month to this organization and I'm sure thousands of other Singaporeans do the same thing as well, and in bigger amounts too. No doubt, it supports a good cause and has over 2000 people to support, but I'll be looking for a worthier cause to donate my precious dollar to. Note: This blog has no intention of offending anyone related (or not) to the charity foundation. I'm just airing my views.

With the renewed effort to look for a new job, editing the cv/resume has begun. ugh. it's such a bother having to think of my current roles & responsibilities, achievements and skills so that i can effectively "sell" myself to potential employers. how do you impress without having to embellish the truth? would blogging be considered a skill for editorial jobs? just imagine SH editors surfing through this pink site. i could be the next Sumiko Tan. i don't fancy being any of the political writers. if you think i want to write about anything heavier than the weight of my shoe, think again. thankfully for all readers, sph is not my next career choice. it would be great if someone paid me to sit at home and plan my next holiday. (ok, i will officially drop the topic of my holiday - past, present or future - from all blogs from now till.. my next holiday!) i did think i could be an events coordinator or party hostess (not KTV!!) but then, i realised that i can be quite anti-social, which might pose a slight problem in that line of work. where's the an oil sheikh when i need one? life as a "sheikhess"(??? is that what you call a female sheikh?) would be awesome.

So, I went out on friday to Clarke Quay for food (Satay!) and Equinox for drinks/dance. Just for the record, the music at Equinox was like a very bad retro night at Zouk. The DJ obviously did not graduate from DJ-school cos the changes in genre was abrupt. Beyonce, 50 cents and all my R&B pals did not make an appearance on the playlist. At. All. Nonetheless, we were determined to stick it out for at least a decent song. Like every other bad club I've been to in my life time, the longer one waits, the less likely one will get to listen to good music. Although, the definition of good music is very subjective. But Equinox, like all other clubs, doesn't disappoint in terms of being good fodder for gossip and people watching. The last time I was there, I cam across a couple making out frantically in one of the booths. Heh, that was funny. They were close to dry humping and it was only 10pm!! Yesterday we were in the lift with 3 people, one Asian guy and 2 British women who were friends. All three had British accents, but it was apparent that the guy had just met the two girls at the club. On the way down, one girl asked the guy "Did you just learn that accent?" To which he replied, "I'm a fast learner" She then pointed to her friend and asked "From her??" Thankfully, the lift door opened cos bv was desperately trying to control his laughter. oh, the ridiculous-ness of it all!

Well, in a space of 1 day/night, I've finally have got news to tell. (I'm not a voyeur, but some things should be shared.) 1) My one and only female colleague (receptionist) tendered her resignation yesterday after a spat with one of the bosses. No, it wasn't a scream-fest, but said boss started quizzing her about long-forgotten Maths topics (conversion of mm to m) which confused this lady. She told him so. He, in turn, started cussing and muttering something about having to know this f****** sh!t etc. Already suffering from low-morale at work (and she isn't the only one), that was the final straw for her and 2 hours later, she handed her letter to the other boss. So, her last day will be on the 17th of July, after which, I am sure, I'd be ask to take over her duties as well. Yeah, I'll single-handedly be in charge of the HR/Accounts/Finance/Admin department. This act has prompted our new IT personnel to seriously ponder about his future at the firm as his 3 months probation will be up in July. For the record, I'm doubling my efforts to find a new job. 2) After a fairly momentous day at work, I was very excited at night cos I finally went for my run and was very confident that I could stay up to at least watch the England Vs Switzerland match. (Well, mainly cos Whose Line Is It Anyway was showing at midnight.) Lo-and-behold, we received a call at 10.30pm from one of my brother's friends (he was in school for the freshman camp) who told us that my brother was possessed. Now, believe what you will (I've always been a skeptic when it comes to these things) but my brother has the "gift" of a third eye. So we hurried to his school, which is all the way in the west, to get him. He wasn't turning his head 360 degrees or spewing vomit a la The Exorcist , but was incredibly weak. At times, he forgot his own name and could only look at you blankly, but this was interspersed with long periods of lucidity. We found out from friends that the first attack was particularly bad and it took 8 of his friends to hold him down cos he was kicking and screaming. Thankfully, right now, he is sound asleep at home and hopefully will be right as rain in a few days' time.

I've been feeling dissatisfied with my life, especially regarding work, for quite some time now. A year since I've graduated and I can say that nothing much has improved. My trip to New Zealand has shown that there is more to life than my 9-5 job in a firm that is increasingly becoming tiresome. But expressing a desire to travel all my life was met by disbelief and an exclamation that such a life is unrealistic. Alarmingly, I think that I still don't know what to do in life. The idea of spending 30 years in a career related to what I've studied terrifies me. But am I good enough to make a switch to something completed unrelated to accounting? It all boils down to self-belief I suppose. (Gah. I'm just feeling sorry for myself cos I've got no more leave and my vacation is long over and I'm missing someone.)

This site is also no longer called "Lava Deposits..." but "A little piece of heaven..." Why? Well, cos this is a little piece of heaven! (I dare you to say otherwise.) So send in your comments/suggestions and I may take them into consideration depending on my mood. Oh, and to those people on my "regular contributors" list, if there aren't any contributions by the end of the week, I'll be removing that section as well.

Three days into Euro 2004 and I've not watched a single match. In all fairness, I did try to stay/wake up to watch them on cable tv. But i have no will-power. It was just too much of a bother. Even the lure of 22 sweaty men running around like hapless chickens chasing after a ball is not enough to make me get up at an un-godly hour of 2.50am. Anyway, what with France scoring only at the very end of the match, watching the first 90 minutes would have been a complete waste of time.

Ooh. Blogging for the third time today. This must be a new record. So guess where i went today? The urlLink zoo ! The last time i went to the zoo was when i was 12!!! It was hot and humid but very enjoyable day. A good way to spend 3 hours of my precious weekend away. Everything but the smell has changed alot since i last visited the place. Boy, do the camels stink! No one was mauled by a tiger, since all them animals were fast asleep. Which made me think that the zoo should be opened at night, but then i realised that that is what the night safari is for. ;p Surprisingly, my parents were good fun too. (We went to the zoo on a whim.) Anyone interested in volunteering can go to this urlLink website .

For once, I am actually interested in watching sports on TV; especially with the NBA finals being played and the upcoming Euro 2004. (God, I can't believe that I'm swept up in all the hype of Euro 2004.) Lest you think that the reason is cos of all the cute guys, let it be known that I don't find the NBA players cute. At all. Euro 2oo4 on the other hand, is a different story altogether. I just have 2 words: Iker Casillas. Having no favourite teams, my loyalties will change as the days go by. One thing's for sure, England Vs France, my loyalties will lie with the team that has no Beckham. Will I actually stay up to watch the matches on telly? Your guess is as good as mine.

Well, it's been a week since i came back. (Un)Fortunately, my office didn't burn down in my absence. So I had to return to work. And I'm proud to say that I've survived the first week!!! Yay! Clearing 3 weeks worth of crap is NOT my idea of fun. Birthday celebrations for today has more or less been pushed to next week. :( But i'm still meeting Daniel(!) today! I've finally gotten over the "jetlag" and have stopped waking up at 5 am and sleeping at 9 plus. For those who don't think that's odd, well, it is! New Zealand is 4 hours ahead of Singapore, so do your own math. Although, I've been craving me some scones with cream and jam. Any idea where I can get it? 1 week on and i still hate the weather here. Some things will never change.

this is for those who give a shite . Blogger changed it's outlook! i can't handle changes!! What is going on around here? So apparently this site has been real quiet. I think I must have lost tons of readers (yeah, seeing as my blog reaches out to millions of people each day) since my (self-imposed) hiatus. New Zealand has been tons of FUN! 19 days is not as long as I thought it would be and returning home was something I absolutely dreaded. As expected, I took as much photos as I could, while facing battery difficulties. I forgot to get the NZ charger and I refused to buy one. So I had to borrow chargers from the hostels. Borrowed one charger in Rotorua but the current in the socket was not strong enough to charge my batteries even though I left them there for 2 days! Well, i should have known since the heating in that hostel was almost non-existent. I bungy jumped over there (and didn't die from it)! So yay for me! Met loads of fantastic people on the bus. And was incredibly sad to say goodbye to them in Christchurch. My photos are all ready and I'll upload them as soon as it is convenient for me. *grin* Knowing how lazy I am (which explains why this blog is almost a non-blog), it would take some time. But I'll really try, for those of you who are dying to know about my trip (again, I stress, that the site reaches out to millions of people each day). NOT. In other news, I turned 23 yesterday. A quiet celebration for one who had to go back to work and was still slightly jet-lagged. (Humour me. I refuse to return back to Singapore time, in the hopes that I'm dreaming and will wake up snuggled under my blanket in Queenstown). Hopefully, a big bash will be in order this weekend. Well, not a big bash, but a night out would be more than preferable.

(Hey! More new blogger features! I just love this website!!) I watched urlLink Mean Girls last week. It was surprisingly entertaining, especially since I'm not a Lindsay Lohan fan. The girl who plays "Regina" is hot, but when did Lacey Chabert (Party of Five) grow up to be so ugly? Well, not ugly, but her face isn't going to launch a thousand ships. What's with her nose? Is that tan even real? (ooh. bitchy) Anyhoo, thinking back to my good ol school days, I definitely didn't fall into any popular group. Not that I'm bitter about it. Someone recently commented that I'm anti-social cos I love solitary sports like swimming and jogging. But I'm not. I like being around other people as much as the next girl but only up to a certain point. After that, I'll get sick of them and prefer my own company. I think that's the thing, I can actually tolerate doing things by myself; shopping, swimming, jogging, cycling, even eating and watching a movie. Plus, I really don't see the need to hang out in a big group and be perceived as "cool". (Maybe I'm just getting old.) In any case, I'm thankful that I'm not in school anymore and having to deal with young bitches like that.

Ok. I finally watched it a few days ago. Now time for my two-bit comments. They don't make racers like they used to. I seriously think the best group of racers came from the first Season. Season 2 was not too bad, but it all got down hill from there. Now, with the fifth instalment of this Emmy-winning show, the racers are going to be grating on my nerves very soon. I like urlLink Linda and Karen (Self-proclaimed bowling moms). Positive throughout the race. I'm neutral towards urlLink Bob and Joyce (internet dating couple), urlLink Chip and Kim , urlLink Colin and Christie and eliminated couple, urlLink Dennis and Erika . Now comes to the good part. Young all girl teams have never made a good impression on me. Remember Leslie and Kim from S1? Or what about that Jaree and Tian in god-knows-which-season? They have a tendency to be bitchy, mean and manipulative. So far, twins urlLink Kami and Karli have not been too annoying (but they were a little slow in reading clues) but I would not put it past them to annoy the hell out of me in the coming episodes. urlLink Marshall and Lance - the token brothers. We had good ones so far, Kevin and Drew (S1) being the most notable pair. Then, Ken and Gerard, Al and Jon and my other fave, Oswald and Danny. Somehow, M&L aren't going to be that likeable, especially judging from the way they complained about the bad night in Uruguay. urlLink Charla and Mirna are just weird and screechy. More so Mirna than Charla. Charla's spunky but Mirna is WHINY. So far, the team I dislike the most. And that whisle.. god, lose the whistle! Ok. getting lazy now. I'm dumping all the other couples together. The ones with the pretty girlfriends and their so-so partner/boyfriends. Father-daughter team is a little irrtating mainly cos of the daughter. But there's always Phil. I like Phil. (YUM!) Well, folks, that, in a nut-shell is the amazing race for you.

Not done my movie reviews in the longest time!!! The movie that has the honour of being my first review in 7 months is " urlLink Super Size Me ". Super Size Me is essentially a documentary about the growing fat problem in America, largely due to the booming fast food industry. Director Morgan Spurlock also embarked on a 30 day, 3 meals a day McDonald's diet, to show how harmful it can be. Some rules to follow: he had to eat everything on the menu at least once. He must also super size his order if asked. I have never actually seen/eaten a super sized meal (the "upsize ones here look like Happy Meals in comparison). The portions are frightening. Who eats that?! Apparently alot of Americans, if the statistics are to be believed. As hilarious as the movie was, it was incredibly disturbing. Not only did Spurlock gain an unhealthy 10+ kg in 30 days, his cholesterol level shot up from 165 to 230 and his liver was turning into pate. Similar to the effects of binge drinking. Spurlock also highlighted the fat-laden cafeteria food found in some schools, with a teenager claiming a plate of french fries to be her vegetable intake. Interspersed with his McDonald's diet were interviews with various people (i can't remember off-hand who they were) and sobering statistics about food and food-related topics. He also interviewed a guy who ate 19 000 Big Macs (averaging about 2 a day) for the past donkey years. That was absurd! Critics and Mcdonald's fans can claim that it was foolish of him to even start that ridiculous diet, which would obviously lead to adverse health consequences. But then again, the amount of fast food consumed by Americans is unhealthy to begin with. Anyway, 2 months after the movie's screening at the Sundance Festival, Mcdonalds recalled its "Super Sized" meals. Whether or not it was due to the movie is anyone's guess.

We've jumped on the Idol bandwagon. Over the next 15 weeks (I think), we will be subjected to people butchering various songs in the hopes of becoming Singapore's first ever Idol. So how was the first episode? Are contestants as delusional as their American counterparts? Quoting from a recent urlLink article in the New Paper, "Indeed, to most of the panel, the biggest eye-opener at the auditions wasn't the discovery of the next Singapore Idol, but how untalented and thick-skinned most of the also-rans were." Wanting to be the next William Hung isn't the most ambitious dream. But Mr Lemon Tree (only those who watched it will know) did have his 15 minutes of fame, at the expense of all sane people watching the show. Nothing was as bad as the guy who took the song "Careless Whisper" to heart and sang it no louder than a whisper. What about the judges and host? Paula, Randy and Simon can rest easy. While some judges did try to incorporate acidic remarks into their speech, Simon still holds the title for being the meanest judge. That music producer, Ken has the bad habit of looking at someone through the top of his glasses. I HATE that. But maybe it's all an act to seem condescending and mean. WHATEVER . Nothing particularly remarkable about them. Unfortunately, just like the contestants, the judges were very bland as well. I guess I should be thankful that there wasn't a whole lot of Gurmit. Ryan Seacrest he isn't. That's for sure. All in all, Singapore Idol is turning out to be like past remakes of any American-made TV show. (Think Wheel of Fortune, Pyramid Game etc). Bland and the aspects which should be copied (I mean, you're already re-making it. Why not make it as true to the original as possible?) aren't. For those interested, Singapore Idol will be showing on Channel 5 (tanx mediacorp! i luv u 4eva n eva!!! ;-) from - sunnysunshine girl) on Wednesday at 8.30pm.
